Title: Data Analyst
Description:
hackajob is a matching platform partnering with Simply Business helping them to hire the best talent and build the future. To get the chance to get matched to this role and other similar roles, click on Apply to set up your free profile.




Simply Business is an online business insurance brokerage that specialises in one thing: protecting the businesses their customers are working hard to build. Since they started life in 2005, they have helped over three million small businesses and self-employed people find the protection that‚Äôs right for them, from builders to bakers and personal trainers. Their big idea was to reduce time, hassle and jargon wherever possible, while introducing the simplicity, choice and value that they believe small businesses and landlords are entitled to.




Their story - continued commitment to doing the right thing




2005 seems like a long time ago. Simply Business ‚Äì a small company with a big idea. To transform the way that other small businesses could get the insurance that they need. To reduce time, hassle and jargon wherever possible while introducing the simplicity, choice and value that small businesses are entitled to. To protect them from harm. To keep their livelihoods safe. And to do all this with the promise of positive service. Delivered by happy people, working flexibly, learning constantly. With a restlessly innovative spirit. Within a business committed to doing the right thing. All of the time.




As they've grown, they've tried hard to keep true to this. To ourselves, to their 800 strong team and to the 3.5m customers that they've served so far. And as they move forward, as they enter a big new market, as they grow responsibly, as they improve their products, as they offer their customers more of what they need, of what they deserve, they'll hold onto the focus of that small company with the big idea. Protecting and serving businesses across the UK and the US. From barbers to bakers, consultants to cleaners, they are the backbone of the economy.




And they'll continue to stand by them. Bit by bit helping their dreams grow, just like ours.




Why do they need this role?




This role will sit within the global Data and Analytics team (DNA) in Simply Business. DNA has been central to empowering data-driven decision making at SB. They have invested heavily in their data pipeline, data engineering and their business intelligence capabilities.
In 2023 and beyond, they will continue investing a significant amount of effort in ramping up their Business Intelligence capabilities to drive business decisions.
The primary duty of this role will be to provide analytical support for their business stakeholders. This includes leading the measurement and evaluation of their product value streams and ensuring that they continuously improve the effectiveness of their product investments. Success in this role will require you to be a trusted advisor to their business partners, ensuring they focus their efforts on the most value-added insights initiatives.




In this role, you will:




Create data models in their Snowflake data warehouse
Integrate new sources of data to enrich their analytical capabilities
Work with the engineering and product teams to ensure application design accommodates reporting and analytics requirements
Work with various business and engineering teams to ensure reliable, scalable, robust architecture for their analytics platform and ETL pipelines
Partner with stakeholders to identify business use cases and translate them into the right analytical problem that you will build, test and productionize
Particular focus will be on use cases that will help them drive operational efficiencies as the organization scales.
Increase the organization's ability to convert more customers.
Clearly communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to non-technical audiences
Contribute to longer term strategic DNA projects




What are they looking for:




At least 3 years of overall experience in data & analytics, operational analytics experience is desired;
Degree with analytics or software engineering experience or equivalent work experience;
Experience with cloud data warehouses such as Snowflake or similar;
Experience designing and creating SQL data models using dbt (dbt Certification a plus);
Strong communication and data presentation skills through the use of effective data visualisation and BI tools, e.g. Looker, Tableau, Power BI, etc;
Effective at building strong, influential relationships with colleagues and partners, with demonstrated success in delivering impactful insights to executives;
Self-starter who is comfortable working in a globally distributed team environment
Experience in Python or another programming language (e.g. Kotlin, Scala, Ruby) is welcomed

Title: Data Analyst Associate
Description:
My leading Financial Services client are looking for a Data Analyst to join their CLM and KYC team, within their Data & MI space. You'll be responsible for the production and maintenance of the Data & MI function, including uploading and oversight to the internal reporting repository.




This is a newly created role within a hugely growing area of the organisation. They are a supportive and high performing team, a brilliant opportunity!




The following skills / experience is required:

Strong Data Analyst background
Power BI
SQL, Excel, Python is desirable
KYC understanding is desirable
Previously worked in Financial Services or similar industry
Excellent communication skills




Salary: Up to ¬£60,000 + bonus + package

Grade: Associate

Location: London (good work from home options available)




If you are interested and meet the above requirements please apply immediately.

The following skills / experience is required:

  • Strong Data Analyst background
  • Power BI
  • SQL, Excel, Python is desirable
  • KYC understanding is desirable
  • Previously worked in Financial Services or similar industry
  • Excellent communication skills


Salary: Up to ¬£60,000 + bonus + package

Grade: Associate

Location: London (good work from home options available)


If you are interested and meet the above requirements please apply immediately.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What is Sylvera anyway? ‚Äçüë©‚Äçüë®üå≥

Sylvera provides carbon data for genuine climate impact. Our mission is to incentivize investment in real climate action.

Purchasing credits through the carbon markets is one of the most established and scalable ways to channel finance from the private sector to effective climate solutions and work toward societal net zero. Unfortunately, the voluntary carbon markets have been plagued with mistrust and a lack of effectiveness since they‚Äôve emerged ‚Äì until Sylvera.

To help organizations ensure they're making the most effective investments, Sylvera builds software that independently and accurately automates the evaluation of carbon projects that capture, remove, or avoid emissions. With Sylvera's data and tools, businesses and governments can confidently invest in, benchmark, deliver, and report real climate impact.

Our team is made up of leading minds in climate change from scientists to policy, finance and carbon market experts. We work in partnership with scientific organisations, universities, governments and think tanks to develop and test rigorous and holistic ratings methodologies, leveraging the latest technology. Founded in 2020, Sylvera has employees worldwide with offices in London, New York, Belgrade and Singapore. We‚Äôve raised over $96million from leading VCs like Balderton Capital, Index Ventures and Insight Partners to date.

What will I be doing? ‚Äç‚Äçüë©‚Äçüíªüë®‚Äçüíª

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to join our Market Data team and help build the foundation of an exciting new product on market data. This product will integrate proprietary data and advanced modelling techniques to estimate market supply, demand, and prices.We expect this new product to be deployed widely to our subscribers, helping them make better informed decisions when investing in climate action. This role offers the opportunity to grow your skills, work on meaningful projects, and contribute to a mission-driven organization tackling climate challenges.

Specific responsibilities include:


Extract, transform, load and analyze data on carbon markets
Develop and maintain data visualization tools that helps users digest data
Help build data pipelines that integrate data between our storage systems
Conduct testing and debugging, ensuring the reliability and performance of our systems
Collaborate with engineers to design, implement, and refine scalable data workflows to support analytics and customer-facing tools



We‚Äôre looking for someone who: üß†üíö


Has minimum of two years experience in data analytics and/or data engineering
Has experience with working with data warehouses such as Snowflake, Databricks or BigQuery
Exposure with using Python and dbt to transform and model data
Has experience with configuring data dashboards such as Tableau, Looker, PowerBi (or similar)
Enjoys working independently and setting their own goals eager to learn and grow, with a proactive attitude toward tackling new challenges
Thrives in a collaborative environment and is open to feedback and mentorship
Shares our commitment to combating climate change and preserving ecosystems



We‚Äôd like someone highly ambitious, motivated and eager to propel their career forward. We prioritise grit, positivity, and the willingness to get stuck in, and encourage you to apply even if your experience doesn't exactly match this job description

Benefits üí∞


Equity in a rapidly growing startup
Private Health Insurance and Life Assurance
Unlimited annual leave
Enhanced parental leave
Access to Mental Health support via Spill
Office bar tab once a month
Weekly drinks in the office
Catered lunch once a month in office
Monthly Deliveroo/equivalent allowance once a month



Location üåç

We work flexibly but encourage people to come in regularly to our great office in Old St

Our Values üôå

Own it: We make new mistakes. We build on the momentum of our wins and reflect on and learn from our failures.

Stay curious: We keep our focus on the long-term, even if that means short-term challenges.

Do what‚Äôs right - even when it‚Äôs hard: We take a growth mindset to our work, our customers, our market and the opportunities ahead of us.

Collaborate and challenge with empathy: Our teams deliver through active collaboration. We invest in each others‚Äô success and make the company stronger in the long-run.

Empower Customers: Make extraordinary efforts to exceed our customer expectations. If we‚Äôre serving our customers to the fullest, we can help direct more investment into real climate impact.

What if you‚Äôre a partial fit? üå±

We prioritise grit, positivity, and the willingness to get stuck in, and encourage you to apply even if your experience doesn't exactly match this job description.

Equal employment opportunity üåà

Sylvera is an equal opportunity employer: we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
üß¢Role | Data Analyst

üè¢Sector | Retrofit Architects

üéØResponsibilities | Drive meaningful decision-making through the power of data. You'll develop visualisations, dashboards, and reports while collaborating closely with multidisciplinary teams to enhance data quality, accessibility, and analysis.

‚≠êPurpose | Your expertise will directly contribute to decarbonising schools.

üìçBased | London Waterloo / hybrid.

‚åöFull-time | 40 hours per week (9am-6pm)

üí∞Salary | up to ¬£40,000




Our client, an architect-led company addressing the climate emergency through school decarbonisation and knowledge-building, is looking for a Data Analyst to support their mission of decarbonising schools. In this role, you'll use your expertise to help architect and non-architect teams understand, interpret, and improve their data for multiple, critical projects.




To excel in this role, you will:




Use tools such as SQL, R, or Python to manipulate, clean, and model data.
Build and deliver interactive dashboards, impactful visualisations, and reports tailored to users‚Äô needs.
Apply innovative analytical techniques to create actionable insights.
Collaborate with architect and non-architect teams to plan better use of data and support improved decision-making.
Combine quantitative and qualitative data to deliver rich user insights and support strategic development.
Apply modern analytical techniques to interpret complex data sets, uncover actionable insights, and support strategic development.
Collaborate across teams to plan data roadmaps, improve data quality, and support innovation projects.
Take a proactive, hands-on approach to resolving data issues and addressing internal data-driven needs, you must be comfortable with both operational and strategic tasks.




Skills You Bring:

A track record of using statistical data analysis frameworks and techniques on large data sets (expertise with projects related to the built environment a bonus), including cleaning and filtering data.
Strong mathematical and statistical skills for analysing messy, complex data.
Creative problem-solving and an ability to think strategically about data patterns and their implications.
Exceptional communication skills to translate technical insights into practical recommendations.




Experience

Experience in building data roadmaps, dashboards, and algorithms to inform decisions.
Proven experience interpreting data and delivering clear, actionable insights to stakeholders.
Track record of working collaboratively in cross-functional teams and building positive relationships with stakeholders.
Strong communication skills to present findings and recommendations effectively.




The team values innovation, collaboration, and a can-do attitude. If you're passionate about using data to create meaningful impact and enjoy working in a dynamic environment, we'd love to hear from you.




This role may require enhanced DBS checks.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Campaign Executive
Location: Fully Remote
Salary: ¬£25,000 + team based commission




Company Overview

Our client is a tech start-up specialising in data, audience and demand acquisition for clients around the globe. No matter who their customers want to reach‚Äîor where‚Äîthey excel at crafting tailored initiatives that reflect the specific needs of target audiences.




About You

We‚Äôre seeking an individual who‚Äôs excited to join a growing, close-knit team and begin (or advance) their career in a vibrant media environment. Prior experience in a B2B operational capacity is ideal, but not mandatory, someone with the drive and willingness to develop alongside the business is more important.




Your Role

Collaborate with the Campaign Management team to ensure that all leads and related data are verified, accurate, and current.
Perform initial quality checks on data by validating it against multiple sources (for instance, verifying job titles, phone numbers, and other essential details).
Set up and launch new campaigns, which involves creating automated checks in our data validation systems and handling any necessary API integrations (full training provided).
Tackle ad hoc tasks as assigned by team leaders or the broader campaign management group.
Keep campaigns running smoothly and deliver top-notch service to all clients, every time.
Provide clear updates on campaign responsiveness to accurately forecast future performance.
Take on operational and analytical duties, like segmenting data and evaluating response rates using various technology platforms (training will be provided).
Double-check data reliability and flag any shortcomings when needed.




Essential Qualifications

A degree in a data-focused area (e.g., Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Sciences, or Engineering)
A passion for data-centric work
Strong communication skills
Energy, enthusiasm, and willingness to align with team objectives




What We Look For

Enthusiasm for working with data
Naturally analytical mindset
Comfort with data-entry tasks
Quick adoption of new tools and software
Strong proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint
Problem-solving mentality
Professional, dependable, and punctual
Ability to work remotely and adapt to flexible schedules
Confidence in meeting goals and quotas
Clear communication and readiness to seek help when needed
Highly driven and motivated
Open-minded and eager to learn from seasoned colleagues
Thrives in a dynamic, positive, and hard-working environment




Culture

This company are developing a lively and supportive environment. Leadership operates within a flat structure, ensuring you can learn directly from the most experienced members of the team. You‚Äôll find this a great place to refine your skills, make real progress, and share a few laughs along the way.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst (SC Cleared)

Location: London (Hybrid)

Contract Type: Inside IR35 - 3 months

Salary: ¬£350 - ¬£400 per day Inside IR35

About the Role:

We are seeking a highly skilled and SC cleared Data Analyst to join our dynamic team in London. This role offers a unique opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, particularly Palantir Foundry, alongside data modelling, analytics, and visualization tools such as Tableau. The ideal candidate will be responsible for deriving actionable insights from complex datasets, modelling data effectively, and driving data-driven decision-making processes within the organization.

Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain data models using Palantir Foundry to streamline data workflows and provide meaningful insights.
Perform complex data analysis and translate business requirements into actionable data-driven solutions.
Build interactive dashboards and visualizations in Tableau to represent key metrics and insights for stakeholders.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy, integrity, and alignment with business goals.
Clean, transform, and preprocess large datasets, ensuring they are optimized for analysis and visual representation.
Develop and implement strategies for data governance, ensuring compliance with industry standards and security protocols.
Provide ongoing support for users, troubleshoot data-related issues, and maintain the data infrastructure.

Key Skills & Experience:

SC Clearance is a mandatory requirement for this position.
Proven experience working with Palantir Foundry, including data integration, modelling, and analytics.
Strong proficiency in Tableau, with the ability to design and build dynamic and user-friendly dashboards.
Extensive experience in data modelling and data wrangling, with a deep understanding of data structures and best practices.
Proficient in using SQL for querying and managing databases.
Knowledge of data analytics tools and technologies such as Python, R, or similar (optional but advantageous).
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data insights into clear and actionable business recommendations.
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines, whilst maintaining attention to detail and accuracy.
Familiarity with data governance, security standards, and best practices.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are working with a leading Cross-border Payment business who are currently looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join their Product & Technology team. You will work closely with the product and tech teams to build dashboards, understand business data needs, and support rollout as the company continues to grow.




This is the first Data Analyst hire for them so there is a lot of scope for personal development and growth within the business as well as establishing a strong data function in a rapidly scaling Fintech.




Responsibilities:

Provide regular reporting to the Product and Technology Director as required
Work with Product and Tech teams to understand data needs and provide data-driven insights
Build dashboards and reports to track business metrics and KPIs
Support rollout of new products and features
Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders, and support and host discussions within a multidisciplinary team
Be an advocate for data in the business, share knowledge and support the wider business with adopting data-led decision making
Ensure data management and governance processes are in place and adhered to for the products and services your teams provide, and define strategies to enable continual improvement of data management practices and compliance with data governance policies.
Build and review complex data models, ensuring adherence to standards.
Utilise data integration tools and languages to integrate and store data, and advise teams on best practice.




Competencies & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g. statistics, mathematics, computer science)
4 years of experience as a data analyst
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with SQL, Excel, and/or Python
Experience with AWS data related solutions including: Redshift, Glue, Athena, Aurora




2 days WFH/3 days in the office - Central London Office

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us:

Solirius Consulting delivers technical consultancy and application delivery to our clients in order to solve real world problems and allow our clients to respond to an ever-changing technical landscape. We partner closely with our clients, embedding our consultants into their businesses in order to provide a bespoke service, allowing us to truly understand our clients' needs.

It is this close collaboration with our clients that has enabled us to grow rapidly in recent years and will drive our ambitious future growth plans. We currently have over 250 consultants working with a variety of key clients from both the public and private sectors such as the Ministry of Justice, Department for Education, FCDOS, UEFA, International Olympic Committee and Mercedes Benz; with plans to increase our client base further in the near future.

We operate as a flat organisation and believe in trusting and supporting our team to operate independently. We pride ourselves on being specialists at what we do, making the most of our consultants' expertise in their fields in order to provide a best-in-class service to our clients. All our consultants have the opportunity to work on a range of different projects, providing a broad range of knowledge on which to develop their careers and progress in the direction they choose.

The Role:

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team here at Solirius. You will be working as part of a team, developing and delivering exciting projects with a fantastic team of technology experts. You will be a fundamental part of the team and will be an expert in your field/specialism.

Requirements

Key Responsibilities:


Develop data solutions for our clients/projects
Diagnostics and Analysis for complex technical projects
Working collaboratively with the client and understanding their requirements
Working with a range of technical professionals to reach a desired outcome, including designing and delivering technical solutions



Key Skills/Experience:


Extensive experience of Data Analytics and Data Science with the ability to use BI tools like Power BI, Tableau etc.
Extensive knowledge of Performance Analytics and tooling such as Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Amplitude etc.
Experience in capturing requirements and Governance & Control documentation, knowledge of GDS is an added advantage
Applied experience of metadata analysis, fields/entity, and data lineage, sql/ no sql databases
Experience with one of Azure/AWS/GCP
ETL tools like Informatica, Alteryx and Business Glossary tools like Collibra, Azure Purview or Apache Atlas
TDD/BDD, Experience working in an Agile development environment
Identity management and synchronisation will be an add on for the resources
Experience with Data Dictionaries, Business glossaries would be an advantage



Benefits

Package and Benefits:


Competitive salary, dependent on experience
Flexible working / Work from home
Private Healthcare
Generous annual discretionary bonus
25 days annual leave + bank holidays
10 days allocated development training per year
Contributory pension
Gym membership
Annual away days and social events



Equality & Diversity:

Solirius Consulting is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating a work environment that supports, celebrates, encourages, and respects all individuals and in which all processes are based on merit, competence and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexuality, age, disability, ethnicity, marital status or any other protected characteristics.

Should you require further assistance or require any reasonable adjustments be put in place to better support your application process, please do not hesitate to raise this with us.

Title: Data Analyst (Property)
Description:
Data Analyst (Real Estate)




Team: Operations

Role: Permanent, Full-time

Location: London (North)

Salary: Competitive + Performance Bonus + Benefits

WFH: 4 days office-based (1 day work from home)







Key Responsibilities:




Assist the department manager to ensure key projects are delivered within a planned time frame.
Providing accurate reports to various internal departments and external professional advisers as required.
Reviewing and extracting information from various sources including leases and the HM Land Registry website.
Reconciling, identifying and correcting data discrepancies on our in-house database.
Identify areas of inefficiency and collaborate with team members to design and implement new processes. Ensure these improvements align with company standards and monitor their effectiveness.
Analyse current workflows to identify opportunities for automation, using appropriate software tools to reduce manual tasks. Test and optimize automated processes to maintain accuracy and reliability.
Stay updated on technological advancements, assess their potential impact, and support the integration of new solutions. Coordinate with IT and other departments to ensure seamless implementation and enhanced system capabilities
Apply programming skills to develop and maintain automation scripts using PowerShell or similar languages. Provide documentation and training on these scripts to ensure efficient and secure operations.
Document all processes and maintain detailed records of system configurations and changes.
Coordinate systems development including planning, designing, executing, documenting and monitoring every aspect of a project.
Manage and develop website content and appearance.
Responsible for the support and maintenance of the database, including data integrity, security and optimisation.




Person Specification:




Degree or similar qualification.
Demonstratable experience with database management and process automation Intermediate or above knowledge of a programming language.
At least 1 year of work experience in a similar role.
Able to show accuracy and speed when entering data into a database, and copying from written and oral sources.
Familiarity with the latest technology trends and products.
Able to communicate effectively, help provide accurate information, and maintain a professional attitude at all times.







Our ambition is simple ‚Äì to do our best for our people, clients and communities.

We are determined to make a positive difference at work and beyond - this starts with hiring the best talent without consideration of race, religion, colour, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status or disability.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're hiring the very best data analysts to join our agile in-house team. You will be working on the fastest growing direct to consumer (e-commerce) brands and will have access to unlimited performance bonus.




What You'll Be Doing

Launch and optimize social, native and search advertising campaigns
Improve Conversion Rate across multiple funnels - multivariant and A/B testing
Design new funnels and analyse granular data using proprietary data warehouse
Manage unlimited budget while staying profitable. Compensation is directly correlated to your personal campaign performance and paid monthly
Optional managerial roles available




What You'll Need

Results-driven and numbers-oriented personality
High attention to detail
Flexibility and adaptability
Commitment to innovations




A little about us

We're passionate about building life changing consumer products and delivering them with astonishing service. We are also one of the UK's fastest growing direct to consumer companies.




The Benefits

Salary above market
All the latest tech you need
Pension plan

Title: Customer Data Analyst
Description:
Customer Data Analyst

Travel | Loyalty

¬£55,000 - ¬£62,000

South London ‚Äì 2 days in the office







The Company:

I'm currently working with a global loyalty and rewards program to hire an Analyst for their growing team. This is a brand new role which will look to tie two parts of the business together and create a holistic view of the customers and how they interact with the business. You will be supporting the global digital and offline program with data and insights across all channels.







As Customer Data Analyst you will:

Create and manage dashboards and reports to track key metrics, enabling the business to evaluate and improve the program, marketing, and product activity.
Collaborate with the team to execute analytical projects focusing on loyalty, customer value, lifecycle stages, cross-group activities, and omnichannel engagement.
Perform data quality checks to ensure data accuracy and consistency throughout the datasets.
Evaluate the performance of campaigns and programs by analysing key indicators, including Incremental and Assisted revenue.
Act as a subject matter expert, proactively addressing business queries and providing insights through both strategic briefs and ad hoc requests to drive customer growth, engagement, and retention.







Requirements:

3 + years of experience working with large volumes customer data
Has experience working on loyalty programs
Experience with visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Experienced in SQL ‚Äì Python is desired







If you're interested in this Customer Data Analyst opportunity please apply below...

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Job Position: Graduate Data Analyst ‚Äì via the Graduate Development Programme

Locations: London

Starting Salary: ¬£28,000

Application Requirements:

Minimum 2:1 or above in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) subject
Experience in analysing data
Right to work in the UK unsponsored for the duration of the programme
Ability to work on site 5 days a week.




Grayce is not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register and is unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants.







Grayce specialises in driving change and transformation for some of the world‚Äôs most ambitious organisations. For over a decade, we've partnered with FTSE 100 and 250 companies to deliver impactful results by developing and deploying high-performing talent in the UK and beyond.




Our Accelerated Development Programme is designed to launch the careers of recent graduates eager to make an impact. We offer a fast-track route to expertise, allowing you to gain hands-on experience with one of our impressive clients in a variety of flexible roles such as Data Analysis, InfoSec, Software Testing and DevOps.




Join Grayce and accelerate your career!

Why Grayce?

Our Analysts are actively involved in major global transformation programmes across diverse industries.

Opportunity: You'll embark on a journey of continuous learning, gaining industry-accredited qualifications, whilst getting hands-on experience working full time on site directly with prestigious FTSE100, 250, and 500 organisations.

Delivery: You will work with one client, delivering high quality outcomes during your Grayce tenure, before transitioning to working directly for them. The skills required for exceptional client delivery include natural curiosity, proactivity, adaptability, effective communication and problem solving.

Mentoring: Thrive under the guidance of our experienced Delivery Managers and Technical Trainers. They‚Äôll be your go-to, offering support, insights, sharing experiences.

Progression: Starting as an Analyst with the potential for significant salary progression, you will pick up invaluable skills and complete a minimum of 6 industry recognised accreditations during your time on the development programme.







What makes a great Grayce Analyst

2:1 Undergraduate Degree: An undergraduate degree with a minimum 2:1 within in a STEM field. A solid academic basis within data analysis and science through an additional MSc would be an advantage.

Data Tools: Previous experience with tools such as Excel, R, SQL or Python are an essential for this role. If you have utilised visualisation programmes such as Tableau or Power BI in projects before, we are also keen to hear from you.

Analytical Problem Solving: We're looking for analytical minds that can spot patterns and think creatively. Whether it's dissecting complex issues or finding fresh angles, we highly value critical thinking skills and their application.

Soft Skills: From effective communication styles to planning, organisation and a learning development mindset, Grayce is committed to building core consultancy skills. Stakeholder and time management are core skills we utilise every day and we look for examples of those through our interview process.




Why work for us?

Competitive Salary: Starting at ¬£28,000 with potential for significant growth

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Curve was founded with a rebellious spirit, and a lofty vision; to truly simplify your finances, so you can focus on what matters most in life.

That‚Äôs why Curve puts your finances simply at your fingertips, so you can make smart choices on how to spend, send, see and save your money. We help you control your financial life, so you can go out and live the life you want to live.

With Curve you can spend from all your accounts, track spend behaviour and provide insights, and security to protect you from fraud. For the first time giving you bright insights and control of all your money in one beautiful place.

We‚Äôre developing a ground-breaking product with our customers at the core. Our user base is growing rapidly and we have exceptional metrics. We have funding from the leading names in tech investment, and a visionary leadership team who wants everyone who joins this remarkable adventure, to have the autonomy to masterfully develop their expertise.

Welcome to Curve. On a mission to help you live inspired.

Curve is seeking a Data Analyst to join our team and help drive data-led decisions within the organisation. In this role, you will work closely with stakeholders and executives to identify opportunities that will delight our customers.

Your primary focus will be on customer interactions and retention. You will get to make use of Curve‚Äôs rich transactional and product data, and overlay it with customer interactions with our support team to get an understanding of what pain points customers face and how we can improve our overall customer experience.

You will report to the Head of Analytics who will assist with career development and guidance. The ideal candidate will have at least one year working experience as a data analyst or commercially focussed role, preferably in a growth-focused company. A background in behavioural science, psychology, economics, mathematics, or statistics is an advantage. Experience with SQL, data warehouse modelling, data pipelines, and data visualisation tools is a plus.

If you are a curious, data-driven individual with a passion for analytics and business strategy, we encourage you to apply. We offer a challenging work environment, autonomy, and huge opportunities for career growth.

Key Accountabilities:


Discovery analyses: Proactively identifying discovery opportunities - you understand the business and customer impact of product decisions and know what is or is not important in helping Curve meet its goals.
Evangelisation: Helping us implement a data-driven mindset in the company by educating others and building self-service reports.


Skills & Experience:


A passion for data discovery, interpretation and storytelling with experience extracting insights from raw data and converting them into product/business recommendations.
2-3 years working experience as a data analyst, preferably in fintech, consumer tech startups, financial services or consultancies.
A direct communication style - you‚Äôre not afraid to ask questions and speak your mind
Flexibility to quickly adapt to changing priorities within a very dynamic startup environment.
Ability to build relationships and maintain trust with various stakeholders across the business.
Proven track record of using SQL to manipulate and extract data.
Advantage: First or second class degree in any discipline or a background in behavioural science, psychology, economics, mathematics or statistics
Advantage: Familiarity with business intelligence and data visualisation tools (ideally Looker).
Effective and flexible communication skills, including the ability to translate technical detail into business and commercial objectives, and vice versa.
Ability to write research papers that succinctly summarises the issue and provides recommendations to stakeholders.
Proven record of taking proactive action based on your own findings and analysis.


Ôªø ÔªøBenefits:


25 days plus bank holidays
Bonus days off for Learning & Development, Mental Wellbeing, Birthday, Moving House & Christmas
Working abroad policy (up to 60 calendar days per year)
Bupa Health Insurance (YuLife)
Life insurance powered by AIG (5x Annual Salary)
Pension Scheme powered by ‚ÄúPeople‚Äôs Pension‚Äù (4% Matched)
EAP (Mental health & wellbeing support, Life coach, Career coach)
24/7 GP access (Smart Health via YuLife)
Annual subscriptions to Meditopia & FIIT for your mind and body (via YuLife)
Discounted shopping vouchers (via YuLife)
Enhanced parental leave
Ride to work scheme & Season ticket loan
Electric car scheme
Six nights of Night Nanny for new parents
Free Curve Metal subscription for you and your +1

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
SAPI builds, tailors, funds and manages your custom financing products. We offer an all-encompassing API for all business credit products to help you meet the needs of your customers. Our mission is to provide liquidity for the global payment ecosystem. Join us!

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making. You will work closely with different departments to analyze trends, monitor KPIs, and contribute to the overall success and efficiency of our operations.

Key Responsibilities:


Gather, analyse, and interpret data from multiple sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize data effectively
Collaborate cross-functionally to provide data-driven recommendations that impact strategy and operational efficiency
Support strategic initiatives through data analysis, interpretation, and dissemination
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in clear, actionable formats



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Business, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field
Proven experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst or similar role
Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets
Strong communication skills to present data insights clearly and effectively to stakeholders
Experience in the fintech industry is a plus
Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills



Benefits


Fully flexible working hours - Our core hours are 11am to 4pm, but outside of these you decide if you thrive AM or PM
Hybrid - 1 day per week in our London office (Shoreditch) - We trust you and we're sure you'll do great work from home
Generous parental leave - We're keen to make sure you are there for your family
Full access to LinkedIn Learning - We believe a culture of learning is paramount to success, so you can benefit from more than 100,000 courses on a variety of topics to nurture your growth
Full access to Calm - Your well-being and overall mental health are of utmost importance to us, so we are keen to ensure you feel supported in this regard
6 weeks remote work throughout the year - Feel free to travel, visit friends or family you might have abroad or simply recharge by working from home during this time
30 days holiday allowance additional to bank holidays - We're keen to make sure you have time to rest and enjoy life outside work
Show more
HTML:
SAPI builds, tailors, funds and manages your custom financing products. We offer an all-encompassing API for all business credit products to help you meet the needs of your customers. Our mission is to provide liquidity for the global payment ecosystem. Join us!

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making. You will work closely with different departments to analyze trends, monitor KPIs, and contribute to the overall success and efficiency of our operations.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Gather, analyse, and interpret data from multiple sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights
  • Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize data effectively
  • Collaborate cross-functionally to provide data-driven recommendations that impact strategy and operational efficiency
  • Support strategic initiatives through data analysis, interpretation, and dissemination
  • Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in clear, actionable formats


Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field
  • Proven experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst or similar role
  • Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
  • Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets
  • Strong communication skills to present data insights clearly and effectively to stakeholders
  • Experience in the fintech industry is a plus
  • Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills


Benefits

  • Fully flexible working hours - Our core hours are 11am to 4pm, but outside of these you decide if you thrive AM or PM
  • Hybrid - 1 day per week in our London office (Shoreditch) - We trust you and we're sure you'll do great work from home
  • Generous parental leave - We're keen to make sure you are there for your family
  • Full access to LinkedIn Learning - We believe a culture of learning is paramount to success, so you can benefit from more than 100,000 courses on a variety of topics to nurture your growth
  • Full access to Calm - Your well-being and overall mental health are of utmost importance to us, so we are keen to ensure you feel supported in this regard
  • 6 weeks remote work throughout the year - Feel free to travel, visit friends or family you might have abroad or simply recharge by working from home during this time
  • 30 days holiday allowance additional to bank holidays - We're keen to make sure you have time to rest and enjoy life outside work

Title: Data Analyst - Anti-Piracy
Description:
Want to do the best work of your life? With 24 million customers in 6 countries, make your mark at Europe's leading media and entertainment brand. A workplace where you can proudly be yourself; our people make Sky a truly exciting and inclusive place to work.

We are seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our Anti-Piracy Team who will support our Anti-Piracy lab, investigators and intelligence teams with insights gained from analysing company and 3rd party data. The ideal candidate will be adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods using a variety of data tools.

They should have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights as well as being comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

What You'll Do


Ensuring data is accurate , complete, and properly formatted"
Using statistical tools to identify patterns and trends in data"
Creating charts, graphs, and dashboards to represent data analysis results"
Presenting findings to stakeholders in reports, dashboards, and visualizations"
Identifying business challenges and formulating data-driven solutions"
Working with programmers, engineers, and data scientists to improve processes"
Creating documentation so stakeholders can understand the data analysis process"
Staying up to date with industry trends and new analytical techniques"
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.


What you'll bring:


A strong analytical mindset, proficiency in querying and manipulating large datasets, and the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business decisions.
Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders utilising BigQuery , Tableau, Looker Studio alongside Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or other Cloud providers.
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, SLQ, SPLUNK etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
Experience working with and creating data architectures.
Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques
Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages
Understanding distributed data/computing tools


Team overview:

Sky's Group Anti-Piracy team's purpose is to make our great content"unavailable"to pirates, and to make pirated content"unattractive"to consumers. We prevent the theft of Sky's content by making sure our platforms, like Sky Q, are secure"and we deploy cutting edge technology, intelligence and investigations to stay one step ahead."We enforce the law "and we work with our partners, like the big tech and social media platforms,"to make sure that they understand the threat, and take action .

The Rewards

There's one thing people can't stop talking about when it comes to : the perks . Here's a taster:


Sky Q, for the TV you love all in one place
The magic of Sky Glass at an exclusive rate
A generous pension package
Private healthcare
Discounted mobile and broadband
A wide range of Sky VIP rewards and experiences


How you'll work:

We know the world has changed, and we want to offer our employees the chance to collaborate at our unique office spaces, whilst enjoying the convenience of working from home.

We've adopted a hybrid working approach to give more flexibility on where and how we work. You'll find out more about what this means for this role during the recruitment process.

Your Office Base

Osterley

Our Osterley Campus is a 10-minute walk from Syon Lane train station. Or you can hop on one of our free shuttle buses that run to and from Osterley, Gunnersbury, Ealing Broadway and South Ealing tube stations. There are also plenty of bike shelters and showers.

On campus, you'll find 13 subsidised restaurants, cafes, and a Waitrose. You can keep in shape at our subsidised gym, catch the latest shows and movies at our cinema, get your car washed, and even get pampered at our beauty salon.

Inclusion

At Sky we don't just look at your CV. We're more focused on who you are and your potential. We also know that everyone has a life outside work, so we're happy to discuss flexible working.

We are a Disability Confident Accredited Employer, and welcome and encourage applications from all candidates. We will look to ensure a fair and consistent experience for all and will make reasonable adjustments to support you where appropriate . Please flag any adjustments you need to your recruiter as early as you can.

Why wait?

Apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. We can't wait to hear from you.

To find out more about working with us, search on social media. A job you love to talk about.

Just so you know: if your application is successful, we'll ask you to complete a criminal record check. And depending on the role you have applied for and the nature of any convictions you may have, we might have to withdraw the offer.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Kensington And Chelsea, England, United Kingdom
Description:
About

SailGP is the world‚Äôs most exciting racing on-water. The annual, global championship ‚Äì

established in 2018 and entering its fifth season ‚Äì features national teams battling in short,

intense races at iconic stadium-style venues across the globe.

The high-tech, high-speed action features the sailing's best athletes racing in identical

hydrofoiling F50 catamarans, flying at speeds approaching 100 km/h who compete for the

sport's top prize money, with US$7 million at stake over the season.

SailGP also races for a better future, championing a world powered by nature. In 2020,

SailGP set a new standard as the first climate positive sports and entertainment property

and began delivering actions and innovations that advance the global adoption of clean

energy. Underpinning the organization‚Äôs purpose-driven agenda is a diversification of the

league, with the goal of immediately progressing gender and racial equity and inclusivity.

SailGP is a global organization with defined values that shape the culture of its diverse

team: deliver quality, break boundaries, make an impact, stand together and strike a balance.

Role summary

We're seeking a talented and motivated Data Analyst to join our growing team and to provide data analysis services for the F50s and the wider SailGP data ecosystem during the 2025 season. The successful individual will be responsible for analysing data with the rest of the data team for the F50s, sustainability, while helping to develop software tools for the role. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone that is looking to learn and grow in an exciting international organisation, work with a wide range of technology, have exposure to cutting edge technology, have involvement in projects and be able to make an immediate impact. You will work in an analysis team and report to the Lead Data Analyst.

Responsibilities


Provide onsite support in the form of performance analysis services to coaches and teams on an ad hoc basis.
Provide help desk support to the teams for performance related queries.
Assist with on-water calibrations within the team‚Äôs control.
Help the team's coaching staff during debrief sessions where required.
Provide data analysis services for the rest of the Sail GP ecosystem such as sustainability or broadcast.
Create and update analysis dashboards for team, broadcast and wider use.
Creating documentation for the teams in relation to performance analysis and on water calibrations where required.


Technical Skills Required


A strong sailing background with an understanding of performance related parameters and how they impact on a boat's performance is a must have attribute.
A good knowledge of Python.
An engineering (STEM) degree.
The ability to translate complex information into easy to digest feedback for teams and SailGP internally.
Report writing.
Comfortable working in Google G-Suite.
Good all-round technology knowledge and experience.
Experience with ML/AI techniques and proficiency building models and analyzing large datasets.


Attributes


Excellent spoken and written communication skills
Ability to operate both independently and in a collaborative, team environment.
Superior organisation, prioritisation and coordination skills.
Ability to work effectively and thrive in a fast-paced, start-up environment.
Culturally sensitive and able to effectively work globally.
Ability to work under pressure.
A valid passport.


Location & Time


UK or Eurozone
The majority of the time you will be remotely based.
You will attend a majority of our 15 events on site during the 2025 season and work alongside the data analysis team.
This is a contractor position


SailGP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role

We are passionate about data. We collaborate to build elegant, effective, scalable and highly reliable solutions to empower predictive modelling in finance.

Cubist‚Äôs data services group is looking for a Data Analyst to join our dedicated team. Our group is responsible for the timely delivery of comprehensive and error-free data to some of the most demanding and successful systematic Portfolio Managers in the world.

This exceptional individual will be a member of a small team of Data Scientists/Analysts who play a vital role in ensuring the smooth day-to-day implementation of a large research infrastructure, and the live production trading of billions of dollars of capital across global capital markets, including equities, futures, options and other financial instruments.

Responsibilities


Identifying potential data sources
Coordinate with compliance team and legal team on new vendor trial/subscription process
Assist with collecting and maintaining overviews and vendor content offering
Assist with data questions and requests from investment teams
Setting up feed download and monitor check in database
Monitoring the automated data collection and cleansing infrastructure
Coordinating meetings and conference calls between data users and experts.
Assist in organizing presentations
Handle user requests and answer questions about data
Download trial datasets from vendor FTP sites or other delivery mechanism
Assist Data Team with manual data processing as required
Maintain Cubist Data Wiki contents


Requirements


Basic level programming experience in Python and SQL. Experience with AWS and Airflow preferred but not required
Financial industry experience preferred but not required
Strong organization, communication and interpersonal skills
Attention to detail and a love of process
Strong oral and written communication skills
Ability to exercise sound judgment in assessing and determining how to handle queries, calls and issues
Ability to multitask and prioritize assignments
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, DAX
Description:
Accepting Applications Until

20 January 2025

Job Description

At Global, we think big, work hard, and never stand still. We‚Äôre the proud home of the best media and entertainment, driven by our talented and passionate people. Our mission? To make everyone‚Äôs day brighter‚Äî our Globallers, our audiences, our partners, and our communities. Whether we‚Äôre in the studio, building world-class technology, or securing record Outdoor advertising partnerships, we make sure we‚Äôre doing it as a team.

Your new role

As a Data Analyst, DAX at Global, you will be part of Global‚Äôs Commercial Data Strategy team. This team is tasked with delivering data-driven solutions and impactful insights to our clients across multiple channels and markets.

You will be working closely with various teams across the Commercial department and will be responding to briefs from our advertising partners, developing compelling insights, and providing actionable post campaign analysis. You‚Äôll also be involved in shaping the future of digital audio by bringing new measurement and targeting solutions to market.

Key Responsibilities


Produce compelling data-led solutions for our Commercial team, including audience planning and measurement frameworks
Deliver insightful and useful post campaign analysis reports.
Lead a group of commercial agency patches and be the go-to expert for strategic data insights
Help drive data product uptake across the Commercial team.
Build strong alignment with colleagues across the Commercial department so that data is used in the right way, at the right times, and to full effect.


What You‚Äôll Love About This Role


Think Big: You will help introduce outstanding and innovative data products to market!
Own It: A keen eye for detail.
Keep it Simple: You will learn how to use a range of exciting analytics and insight tools.
Better Together: You will be part of a hard-working and award-winning team!


What Success Looks Like

In your first few months, you‚Äôll have:


Gained proficiency in Global‚Äôs datasets and analytics tools across Radio and DAX
Responded to briefs and prepared post campaign analysis reports for key clients
Set a personal development plan and defined ways of working


What You‚Äôll Need


The ability to translate complex datasets into impactful, compelling insight
Good understanding of the current and future audio landscape, including the use of 1st, 2nd and 3rd party datasets and the benefits of each
3-5 years of experience within a relevant sector or agency
A passion for the media landscape and the role that data and technology play.
Understanding of Global‚Äôs media assets.
The ability to work collaboratively with colleagues from multiple teams across a business.
Experience with Tableau, Excel, Alteryx or Snowflake is an advantage.


Creating a place we all belong at Global

We are dedicated to creating a place where different voices are represented, amplified and celebrated. We know that we can‚Äôt serve our diverse audiences without first celebrating it in our people, which is why we‚Äôre passionate about creating an inclusive culture where every Globaller can belong. So, no matter who you are or where you are from, you can find your place at Global.

As a business, we believe in the importance of a healthy work-life balance and the value of a flexible and agile workforce. Therefore, we operate a Smart Working approach. If you need us to make any reasonable adjustments during your recruitment process, drop us an email at recruitment@global.com, we‚Äôll be happy to help.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Come join us and make a difference in the world!

Discover more at www.necsws.com

Job Description

As a member of the Healthcare Team, the Healthcare Data Analyst plays a key role in the analysis, interpretation and presentation of healthcare data across NEC‚Äôs services, for delivery to a wide-range of healthcare related organisations. Based upon the underlying data captured through NEC‚Äôs healthcare services, the focus of the role is to work with customers, prospects and other NEC staff to understand reporting requirements from this data, and to use reporting tools such as Business Objects and SQL Server to develop and test these reports in line with customer and market requirements.

The Healthcare Data Analyst will also use market knowledge and customer intelligence in order to specify and develop reports that enhance the value of NEC‚Äôs propositions its customers and to the wider healthcare market

Qualifications

ESSENTIAL COMPETENCIES & EXPERIENCE


Strong professional background and experience in the analysis, interpretation and presentation of data
Strong technical skills in the development and execution of database queries (Microsoft SQL)
Experience of working in a service-based environment (either in a supplier organisation or provision of an internal service).
Experience of working with industry standard reporting tools (e.g. Power BI, Business Objects)
Ability to Experience establish credibility with customers, partners, and colleagues
Ability to establish credibility with wider stakeholder groups to include healthcare professionals and academics
Experience in analysis of large and/or complex data sets, and in the use of advanced techniques and of reporting and analysis packages
A confident, self-motivated individual.
Adaptable and results oriented ‚Äìgets things done
A creative, lateral thinker, able to synthesise information from multiple sources and apply conclusions to issues.
Able to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings and styles; can get messages across that have the desired effect.
Can act with limited supervision within own area of responsibility


Desirable Competencies & Experience


Understanding of the information requirements of stakeholders within the healthcare market
Experience of working with healthcare data
Working knowledge of HES data, and its application to the analysis of healthcare data
Knowledge of R Statistical Computing
Experience of working with Business Intelligence tools
Experience of writing analysis and interpretations for publication


Additional Information

We pride ourselves in offering an excellent benefits package, including an above average pension scheme. When you join the team at NEC Software Solutions, you are provided with the following:


Private Medical Cover funded by NEC for Employees (with the option to add family members at an additional cost)
25 days paid holiday with the option to buy/sell
4 x basic salary life assurance cover funded by NEC (with the option to increase cover at an additional cost)
A Group Pension Plan with fantastic employer contributions up to a maximum of 8.5%
A selection of flexible benefits to suit your individual needs


Candidates must be able to demonstrate a pre-existing right to work and travel within the UK. Documentary evidence will be required.

HTML:
Company Description

Come join us and make a difference in the world!

Discover more at www.necsws.com

Job Description

As a member of the Healthcare Team, the Healthcare Data Analyst plays a key role in the analysis, interpretation and presentation of healthcare data across NEC‚Äôs services, for delivery to a wide-range of healthcare related organisations. Based upon the underlying data captured through NEC‚Äôs healthcare services, the focus of the role is to work with customers, prospects and other NEC staff to understand reporting requirements from this data, and to use reporting tools such as Business Objects and SQL Server to develop and test these reports in line with customer and market requirements.

The Healthcare Data Analyst will also use market knowledge and customer intelligence in order to specify and develop reports that enhance the value of NEC‚Äôs propositions its customers and to the wider healthcare market

Qualifications

ESSENTIAL COMPETENCIES & EXPERIENCE

  • Strong professional background and experience in the analysis, interpretation and presentation of data
  • Strong technical skills in the development and execution of database queries (Microsoft SQL)
  • Experience of working in a service-based environment (either in a supplier organisation or provision of an internal service).
  • Experience of working with industry standard reporting tools (e.g. Power BI, Business Objects)
  • Ability to Experience establish credibility with customers, partners, and colleagues
  • Ability to establish credibility with wider stakeholder groups to include healthcare professionals and academics
  • Experience in analysis of large and/or complex data sets, and in the use of advanced techniques and of reporting and analysis packages
  • A confident, self-motivated individual.
  • Adaptable and results oriented ‚Äìgets things done
  • A creative, lateral thinker, able to synthesise information from multiple sources and apply conclusions to issues.
  • Able to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings and styles; can get messages across that have the desired effect.
  • Can act with limited supervision within own area of responsibility

Desirable Competencies & Experience

  • Understanding of the information requirements of stakeholders within the healthcare market
  • Experience of working with healthcare data
  • Working knowledge of HES data, and its application to the analysis of healthcare data
  • Knowledge of R Statistical Computing
  • Experience of working with Business Intelligence tools
  • Experience of writing analysis and interpretations for publication

Additional Information

We pride ourselves in offering an excellent benefits package, including an above average pension scheme. When you join the team at NEC Software Solutions, you are provided with the following:

  • Private Medical Cover funded by NEC for Employees (with the option to add family members at an additional cost)
  • 25 days paid holiday with the option to buy/sell
  • 4 x basic salary life assurance cover funded by NEC (with the option to increase cover at an additional cost)
  • A Group Pension Plan with fantastic employer contributions up to a maximum of 8.5%
  • A selection of flexible benefits to suit your individual needs

Candidates must be able to demonstrate a pre-existing right to work and travel within the UK. Documentary evidence will be required.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a Digital Data Analyst for an award winning digital consultancy, you will be responsible for working across various types of data focused projects across all client accounts, with the end goal of improving clients' ROI. You will use your digital analytics expertise to deliver data-driven solutions and recommendations. The role combines technical implementation expertise with strategic consulting skills, focusing on delivering data-driven insights and implementing advanced tracking and reporting solutions for clients. In essence, you will play a crucial role in driving digital performance optimisation programmes.




Responsibilities:




Develop and implement comprehensive analytics solutions using GA4 and GTM (and where applicable other analytics tools)
Design and maintain robust data layer specifications
Configure and validate complex tracking implementations
Conduct regular audits to ensure data quality and accuracy
Design, and execute A/B and multivariate testing programs
Lead conversion rate optimisation initiatives
Analyse test results and provide strategic recommendations
Document and share experiment insights
Lead complex data analysis projects across multiple client accounts
Develop and maintain advanced Power BI and Looker Studio dashboards
Conduct customer journey and attribution analysis
Generate actionable insights from multi-source data analysis
Present findings and recommendations to senior stakeholder




Essential requirements:

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as: data science, statistics, computer science, business analytics, etc.
Minimum 5 years experience in digital analytics (ideally including some agency side roles)
Demonstrated mastery of: Google Analytics 4 (implementation, configuration, analysis)
Google Tag Manager (complex implementations, debugging)
Power BI (dashboard creation, data modeling)
Data Layer specification and validation
A/B testing platforms (VWO, Convert.com)




There would be a requirement to be in London at least 2 days a month, ideally 1 day a week if London is easily commutable.




Please note that due to the high volume of responses we receive, only successful applicants will be contacted.




Devonshire is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage job applications from people of all backgrounds. All qualified applicants will receive consideration regardless of gender, race, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, or marital status.

Title: Transportation Data Analyst, Citymapper
Description:
At Citymapper (powered by Via), we‚Äôre on a mission to help make complex cities more accessible to everyday users. Our application transports millions of people in hundreds of cities around the world by giving them access to the most current and sophisticated transportation options available. We make getting around your favorite city easy, so that you can enjoy the ride.




As a Transportation Data Analyst at Citymapper, you will be managing the data that is the backbone of our application‚Äôs success. Your work directly impacts our user experience, and is the difference between a user seeing a bus drive away, or reaching it just in time. Millions of users around the world trust our application to be on time for work, a job interview, or a date - and we take great responsibility in fulfilling that need.




What You'll Do:

You will help to manage the timetable data that powers the Citymapper application. Using proprietary tools and methods, you will transform often messy transit schedules into shiny and reliable user information.
You will build, validate and ship data to production on a daily basis.
You will manage data in a range of cities and across different formats.
You will work with our engineers to build for scale by improving tools and automating tasks.
You will ensure data quality in our web and mobile products so that users continue to love and trust Citymapper.




Who You Are:

You have a passion for public transportation and cities, and an interest in how public transportation networks operate.
You are comfortable dealing with large data sets, and have an eagerness to learn new data skills.
You take a hands-on, practical, pragmatic attitude to your work.
You have exceptional attention to detail, and an ability to communicate those details to other collaborators.
You have up to 3 years of experience working with data, Python and/or common transit data formats (GTFS, TransXChange, Siri, Hafas, etc).




What We Offer:

Becoming part of Via, a company that was awarded for its commitment to social good
Joining the team working on the industry-leading mobile app that is loved and trusted by millions of users
State of the art hardware for you to perform your work worry free
Ongoing support and training to ensure you have the resources you need to thrive and progress in your career
Competitive salary and comprehensive health scheme offered through AXA
A hybrid or remote work model. Remote work is possible if you're based in one of these countries: England, Germany or Netherlands




Founded in 2012, Via pioneered the TransitTech category by using new technologies to develop public mobility systems ‚Äî optimizing networks of buses, shuttles, wheelchair accessible vehicles, school buses, autonomous vehicles, and electric vehicles around the globe.Building the world's most efficient, equitable, and sustainable transportation network for all passengers ‚Äî including those with limited mobility, those without smartphones, and unbanked populations ‚Äî Via works with its partners to lower the costs of public transit while providing transportation options that rival the convenience of a personal car while reducing environmental impact.




At the intersection of transportation and technology, Via is a visionary market leader that combines software innovation with sophisticated service design and operational expertise to fundamentally improve the way the world moves, providing technology in 650 communities and more than 35 countries and counting.




We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. All backgrounds, identities, and voices are welcomed and celebrated at Via.

Ready to join the ride?




Via is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Insights Analyst

üåç UK/Europe (Remote or Hybrid, it‚Äôs up to you!)

üí∞ ¬£28,000 - ¬£35,000 base pa (dependent on experience)







Our Perks

‚ù§Ô∏è Monthly Health & Wellness budget, increasing with length of service

üìö Annual Learning and Development budget, increasing with length of service

ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Flexible working in a choice-first environment - we trust the way you want to work!

üè¢ Work From Home Allowance, which renews every two-years

üå¥ 25 Holiday Days + your local bank holidays, plus an extra day for every year of service

üéÇ Your birthday off

ü§í Paid sick leave

üçº Enhanced Family Leave (UK Only)

üåø Fertility Leave

üë∂ Neonatal Leave

‚öïÔ∏è Optional Healthcare Plan

üõü Life & income protection (Location dependent)

ü§ù Employee Assistance Programme (UK Only)

üìà The ability to share in the company‚Äôs success through options

üçø Perks including discounts on cinema tickets, utilities and more

üéâ Annual Chattermill summits plus regular socials throughout the year

üåÜ If you‚Äôre in London, a dog-friendly office with great classes, events, and a rooftop terrace







ü¶∏‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è The Role ü¶∏‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Our mission is to help large successful brands like Uber, Amazon, Wise, HelloFresh etc. put their customers at the centre of everything they do. Using best-in-class tech in a fast-developing AI space, our Customer Experience Intelligence (CXI) platform continuously analyses explicit and implicit feedback to enable our customers to identify what they should do next.

We're now looking for a talented Insights Analyst to join the team!







üëâ What you'll be doing:

You‚Äôll be helping deliver Experience Led Growth to our platinum accounts through doing data analysis to uncover impactful insights. This means you will work as part of our Insights & Strategy team to:

Conduct data analysis using the Chattermill platform
Support our Experience Led Growth Consultants with high quality and timely data driven insights to deliver to clients
Identify opportunities for clients to improve their Customer Experience outcomes such as their Net Promoter Score
Create Insight Dashboards and Powerpoint Presentations
Present Insights back to clients to help improve their customer experience, growth, and retention







üß∞ What you‚Äôll need:

Experience running experiments using a combination of quantitative and qualitative data analysis
Experience using data analysis tool(s) and to garner insights through the Chattermill platform
The ability to storytell and convey insights through data in an engaging way
Good communication skills and the ability to convey technical concepts to a nontechnical audience
Great attention to detail
A structured approach to problem solving
Confident presentation skills
A collaborative mindset and way of working
A proven track record of working to deadlines







‚ú® Who we are

Co-founded by Mikhail Dubov and Dmitry Isupov in 2015 while at Entrepreneur First, Chattermill was born out of their frustration that it took weeks, sometimes months, for customer research to yield any quality insights. Often, these would be out of date by the time they reached decision-makers. And it was also financially out of reach for most companies. When they started what eventually became Chattermill, they had a hunch that they could use the newly available tech of deep learning to help companies find insights amidst messy data. Their vision was to take what agencies and cutting-edge brands were doing by hand and automate it. Today, our Unified Customer Intelligence platform is used by the world‚Äôs best-loved customer-centric companies, including Uber, HelloFresh, Wise, and more, all of whom can now see and act on their customer reality.

Our Mission & Vision

Our mission is to empower teams to see their customer reality
Our vision is to analyse over a billion pieces of customer feedback by 2027







üîé Our Hiring Process

Let‚Äôs introduce ourselves ‚Äì you‚Äôll have an introductory call with our People & Talent team - we‚Äôd love to learn more about you, your ambitions, and what you‚Äôre looking for in your next step.
Show us what you've got ‚Äì you'll complete a data analysis take home task.
Get to know your would-be team ‚Äì You'll have a call with Dmitry Isupov, our CSO and your would-be manager, as well as our Experience Led Growth Consultant. This will be an opportunity to discuss your task, show off your experience, and get to know the people you'll work most closely with.
How our values and your career goals align ‚Äì you‚Äôll have a call with our co-founder to learn more about life at Chattermill and ensure we‚Äôre the right place for your next stage of growth.







üíñ Our Values

We are obsessed with experience ‚Äì We take our mission to rid the world of bad Customer Experience seriously, and we practice what we preach.
We believe in the power of trust ‚Äì Whether it's with each other, our customers, partners, or other stakeholders, we always communicate with openness and trust.
We act as responsible owners ‚Äì Whether it's about the company, a team, a project, or a task, having the freedom to make decisions in our area of responsibility is a crucial driver for us.
We share a passion for growth & progress ‚Äì On every level, we‚Äôre motivated by taking on new challenges ‚Äì even if they seem out of reach. We recognise that we are learning machines and we always seek to action feedback and improve collectively.
We set our ambitions high but stay humble ‚Äì We've come together to build a product and a category that‚Äôs never been seen before. While we're an ambitious bunch with lofty goals, we don't approach this goal carelessly.
We believe the right team is the key to success ‚Äì At Chattermill we‚Äôve learned that all our important achievements have been the result of the right people collaborating together ‚Äì that‚Äôs why we need you to apply today!







üåà Diversity & Inclusion üåà

We want to enable exceptional experiences for everyone, and to achieve this we need everyone‚Äôs voice in our team. We are on a mission to bring more diversity into the business and to give everyone (from all backgrounds and abilities) a chance to join us, even if they may not fit all of the requirements set out in this job spec. We realise that some may be hesitant to apply for a role when they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the listed requirements ‚Äì we believe in potential and will happily consider all applications based on the skills and experience you have, we‚Äôd love to be part of your growth and we encourage you to apply!
