HTML:
Insights Analyst

üåç UK/Europe (Remote or Hybrid, it‚Äôs up to you!)

üí∞ ¬£28,000 - ¬£35,000 base pa (dependent on experience)



Our Perks

‚ù§Ô∏è Monthly Health & Wellness budget, increasing with length of service

üìö Annual Learning and Development budget, increasing with length of service

ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Flexible working in a choice-first environment - we trust the way you want to work!

üè¢ Work From Home Allowance, which renews every two-years

üå¥ 25 Holiday Days + your local bank holidays, plus an extra day for every year of service

üéÇ Your birthday off

ü§í Paid sick leave

üçº Enhanced Family Leave (UK Only)

üåø Fertility Leave

üë∂ Neonatal Leave

‚öïÔ∏è Optional Healthcare Plan

üõü Life & income protection (Location dependent)

ü§ù Employee Assistance Programme (UK Only)

üìà The ability to share in the company‚Äôs success through options

üçø Perks including discounts on cinema tickets, utilities and more

üéâ Annual Chattermill summits plus regular socials throughout the year

üåÜ If you‚Äôre in London, a dog-friendly office with great classes, events, and a rooftop terrace



ü¶∏‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è The Role ü¶∏‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Our mission is to help large successful brands like Uber, Amazon, Wise, HelloFresh etc. put their customers at the centre of everything they do. Using best-in-class tech in a fast-developing AI space, our Customer Experience Intelligence (CXI) platform continuously analyses explicit and implicit feedback to enable our customers to identify what they should do next.

We're now looking for a talented Insights Analyst to join the team!



üëâ What you'll be doing:

You‚Äôll be helping deliver Experience Led Growth to our platinum accounts through doing data analysis to uncover impactful insights. This means you will work as part of our Insights & Strategy team to:

  • Conduct data analysis using the Chattermill platform
  • Support our Experience Led Growth Consultants with high quality and timely data driven insights to deliver to clients
  • Identify opportunities for clients to improve their Customer Experience outcomes such as their Net Promoter Score
  • Create Insight Dashboards and Powerpoint Presentations
  • Present Insights back to clients to help improve their customer experience, growth, and retention



üß∞ What you‚Äôll need:

  • Experience running experiments using a combination of quantitative and qualitative data analysis
  • Experience using data analysis tool(s) and to garner insights through the Chattermill platform
  • The ability to storytell and convey insights through data in an engaging way
  • Good communication skills and the ability to convey technical concepts to a nontechnical audience
  • Great attention to detail
  • A structured approach to problem solving
  • Confident presentation skills
  • A collaborative mindset and way of working
  • A proven track record of working to deadlines



‚ú® Who we are

Co-founded by Mikhail Dubov and Dmitry Isupov in 2015 while at Entrepreneur First, Chattermill was born out of their frustration that it took weeks, sometimes months, for customer research to yield any quality insights. Often, these would be out of date by the time they reached decision-makers. And it was also financially out of reach for most companies. When they started what eventually became Chattermill, they had a hunch that they could use the newly available tech of deep learning to help companies find insights amidst messy data. Their vision was to take what agencies and cutting-edge brands were doing by hand and automate it. Today, our Unified Customer Intelligence platform is used by the world‚Äôs best-loved customer-centric companies, including Uber, HelloFresh, Wise, and more, all of whom can now see and act on their customer reality.

Our Mission & Vision

  • Our mission is to empower teams to see their customer reality
  • Our vision is to analyse over a billion pieces of customer feedback by 2027



üîé Our Hiring Process

  1. Let‚Äôs introduce ourselves ‚Äì you‚Äôll have an introductory call with our People & Talent team - we‚Äôd love to learn more about you, your ambitions, and what you‚Äôre looking for in your next step.
  2. Show us what you've got ‚Äì you'll complete a data analysis take home task.
  3. Get to know your would-be team ‚Äì You'll have a call with Dmitry Isupov, our CSO and your would-be manager, as well as our Experience Led Growth Consultant. This will be an opportunity to discuss your task, show off your experience, and get to know the people you'll work most closely with.
  4. How our values and your career goals align ‚Äì you‚Äôll have a call with our co-founder to learn more about life at Chattermill and ensure we‚Äôre the right place for your next stage of growth.



üíñ Our Values

  • We are obsessed with experience ‚Äì We take our mission to rid the world of bad Customer Experience seriously, and we practice what we preach.
  • We believe in the power of trust ‚Äì Whether it's with each other, our customers, partners, or other stakeholders, we always communicate with openness and trust.
  • We act as responsible owners ‚Äì Whether it's about the company, a team, a project, or a task, having the freedom to make decisions in our area of responsibility is a crucial driver for us.
  • We share a passion for growth & progress ‚Äì On every level, we‚Äôre motivated by taking on new challenges ‚Äì even if they seem out of reach. We recognise that we are learning machines and we always seek to action feedback and improve collectively.
  • We set our ambitions high but stay humble ‚Äì We've come together to build a product and a category that‚Äôs never been seen before. While we're an ambitious bunch with lofty goals, we don't approach this goal carelessly.
  • We believe the right team is the key to success ‚Äì At Chattermill we‚Äôve learned that all our important achievements have been the result of the right people collaborating together ‚Äì that‚Äôs why we need you to apply today!



üåà Diversity & Inclusion üåà

We want to enable exceptional experiences for everyone, and to achieve this we need everyone‚Äôs voice in our team. We are on a mission to bring more diversity into the business and to give everyone (from all backgrounds and abilities) a chance to join us, even if they may not fit all of the requirements set out in this job spec. We realise that some may be hesitant to apply for a role when they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the listed requirements ‚Äì we believe in potential and will happily consider all applications based on the skills and experience you have, we‚Äôd love to be part of your growth and we encourage you to apply!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us




UM is a global media agency committed to empowering brands to their full potential of growth through the power of patterns by opening a brand‚Äôs aperture and rejecting black-and-white marketing decisions. As the leading global media network in IPG Mediabrands, UM operates in over 100 countries, with more than 3,000 people serving a roster of global clients including American Express, General Mills, Emirates, Johnson & Johnson, Levi Strauss & Co, Dyson, Enterprise holdings, Upfield, Eat Takeaway.com and Mattel. For more information, please visit uk.umww.com.




Reporting to the Associate Director, the Data Analyst works across both our Visualisation and Science workstreams, with the opportunity to benefit from the skills from both divisions.

From developing reporting solutions and dashboards to modelling and other data solutions, the Data Analyst supports various exciting and innovative projects and clients. This role will see you work closely within the analytics team as well with client teams, clients, external partners and other teams across the agency.




Key Responsibilities




Create, QA (quality assure) and maintain visually appealing and insightful dashboards in Tableau to effectively communicate actionable insights to stakeholders.
Understand and translate client requirements to build, QA and maintain efficient workflows. This involves designing and implementing efficient data pipelines to integrate data from various sources into unified, useful formats.
Ensure dashboards and workflows reflect changes in client needs, data sources, or reporting requirements.
Effectively and independently investigate and troubleshoot user problems.
Regularly review workflows and dashboards to identify areas for optimisation and efficiency.
Stay updated with the latest developments in data analytics tools, techniques, and best practices, particularly in Alteryx and Tableau.
Create clear documentation for dashboards and workflows.
Client reporting, involving collecting, cleansing and exploring data sets. Translate data into actionable reports.
Support in Modelling and Forecasting projects across the team.
Actively participate in project meetings and team stand-ups, taking and sharing detailed summary notes, including deliverables, roles and next steps.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions. This involves regular communication with stakeholders to ensure that data analysis meets business needs.




Desired Skills & Experience




An effective communicator, managing expectations of all stakeholders.
Able to proactively ask questions and seek support when required.
Detail and process orientated.
Time management skills to work across multiple concurrent projects or workstreams.
Knowledge of and hands-on experience with Tableau.
Knowledge of and hands-on experience with ETL tools and/or query languages such as Alteryx, SQL etc.
Knowledge of and experience with data warehousing (Snowflake desirable).
Knowledge of and experience with Python or R would be highly beneficial.
A good understanding of the Media landscape and key concepts.
An eagerness to understand client needs and provide solutions.
Curiosity and innovation minded, seeking to increase efficiency and adopt automation.
Connecting and building relationships with other teams across the agency and clients.
Agency experience, with a strong understanding of analytics from an agency's perspective, is a plus.




Employee Transparency




At IPG Mediabrands, we celebrate differences and believe this makes us stronger. IPG Mediabrands are equal-opportunity employers committed to championing an inclusive culture that provides a sense of belonging for all our employees. We do not discriminate against any applicant based on age, disability, race, colour, ethnicity, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, belief, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Please reach out to our Talent Inclusion Specialist Jess at Jess.Richardson@mbww.com if you would like to have a confidential conversation regarding any adjustments that would ensure our recruitment process is accessible for you. Please note requesting a reasonable adjustment will not affect your application.




The Perks




We aim to provide all our people with a supportive and fun work environment where you can develop your full potential and benefit from the broad range of opportunities within the agency. When you join us, we want to make sure you feel valued ‚Äì and that you are rewarded for your fantastic work. So, we also offer a range of benefits:




Flexi‚Äìleave, with 25 days annual leave to be taken as minimum. In addition to your holiday entitlement, the office usually closes between Christmas & New Year
Free breakfast and free lunch
Early finish Fridays
Core Hours (Mon-Thurs, flexible start/finish times)
Retail discounts
Electric vehicle salary sacrifices car scheme
Wellbeing programme, including Headspace & flu jabs
Interest free season ticket loan
Paid time off for Volunteering
Group Income Protection
Life Assurance
Private Medical Insurance or Health Cash Plan (dependent on level)
Group Personal Pension Plan with matched contributions from 3-6%
Generous Parental Leave & Pay
Independent mortgage advice
Financial education
Employee Assistance Programme
Free eye tests
Flexible benefits including Dental, Travel insurance, Cycle to Work, Gym Discounts and many more!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

Job Description

We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our team and drive data-driven decision-making. The ideal candidate will be responsible for gathering, analysing, and interpreting large datasets to provide actionable insights that support business strategy and operations. The Data Analyst will collaborate with multiple departments/clients to ensure data accuracy, identify trends, and help optimize business processes.

Key Responsibilities


Data Collection and Cleaning: Gather data from various sources (databases, reports, APIs) and ensure its accuracy and consistency.
Data Analysis: Analyze datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations, using statistical methods and data visualization techniques.
Reporting and Visualization: Develop clear and concise reports and dashboards (using tools like Excel, Power BI) to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Business Intelligence: Work closely with teams across the company (sales, marketing, product, etc.) to understand business needs and provide relevant data analysis to support decision-making.
Trend Analysis: Monitor and analyze market and industry trends to provide forecasts and actionable insights for business growth.
Data Models and Algorithms: Develop and implement data models, algorithms, and predictive models to enhance business outcomes.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of processes, methodologies, and data sources.
Data Governance: Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance with industry regulations and company policies.


Qualifications


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Experience: 1-3 years of experience in data analysis or a related role.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL etc.
Experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Strong understanding of statistical methods and data modeling.
Experience in working with large datasets and relational databases.
Analytical Thinking: Ability to interpret complex datasets and translate them into actionable insights.
Attention to Detail: Precision and accuracy in data analysis and reporting.
Problem-Solving: Strong critical thinking skills with the ability to identify and resolve issues using data-driven solutions.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to present data findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Title: Data & MI Analyst
Description:
Data & MI Opportunities

Data & MI Team Lead and Data and MI Analyst - Competitive Salary - London - Hybrid




Are you passionate about data-driven decision-making and shaping the future of data strategy? We are hiring for two exciting roles within our newly established Data & MI Team:




1. Data & MI Team Lead

As the Team Lead, you'll play a pivotal role in guiding and developing a high-performing team. You will oversee the design and implementation of data capabilities while driving innovation and aligning data initiatives with business objectives. This leadership role offers a unique opportunity to shape the organization's data strategy, ensuring high-quality results and impactful business outcomes.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead and mentor the Data & MI Team.
Develop and implement data policies, governance frameworks, and infrastructure.
Oversee the creation and optimization of BI models and dashboards, primarily in Power BI.
Drive innovation by integrating advanced analytics and AI capabilities.
Collaborate with stakeholders to foster data-driven decision-making.

Essential Skills:

Proven leadership in data-focused roles.
Expertise in data modeling, SQL, Power BI, and tools like Snowflake, PowerApps, and Power Automate.
Experience with data pipelines, ETL/ELT tools, and governance frameworks.
Strong scripting skills in Python or PowerShell.




2. Data & MI Analyst

As an Analyst, you'll be instrumental in developing data capabilities, ensuring data quality, and delivering actionable insights. This role offers hands-on opportunities to design and implement data solutions that empower business decisions.

Key Responsibilities:

Manage and monitor data sources, pipelines, and systems.
Perform data cleansing, enrichment, and validation.
Build and optimize Power BI dashboards and deliver advanced analytics.
Conduct training sessions and provide ongoing support for business users.

Essential Skills:

Proficiency in data modeling and SQL.
Hands-on experience with Power BI, Snowflake, and automation tools.
Knowledge of ETL/ELT processes, data governance, and scripting languages.
Collaborative approach with a proactive and adaptable attitude.




What We Offer:

A dynamic and supportive environment where innovation is encouraged.
Opportunities to work on cutting-edge data projects and technologies.
The chance to shape the data culture of a forward-thinking organization.




If you‚Äôre ready to make a difference in a growing team that values data excellence, apply today!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DRW is a diversified trading firm with over 3 decades of experience bringing sophisticated technology and exceptional people together to operate in markets around the world. We value autonomy and the ability to quickly pivot to capture opportunities, so we operate using our own capital and trading at our own risk.

Headquartered in Chicago with offices throughout the U.S., Canada, Europe, and Asia, we trade a variety of asset classes including Fixed Income, ETFs, Equities, FX, Commodities and Energy across all major global markets. We have also leveraged our expertise and technology to expand into three non-traditional strategies: real estate, venture capital and cryptoassets.

We operate with respect, curiosity and open minds. The people who thrive here share our belief that it‚Äôs not just what we do that matters‚Äìit's how we do it. DRW is a place of high expectations, integrity, innovation and a willingness to challenge consensus.

As a Data Analyst you will play an integral role in all operational aspects of onboarding, managing and maintaining various datasets used by traders and quantitative researchers. You will work closely with a variety of stakeholders, including technology, front office, operations, research, and risk management. You should be comfortable investigating complex data support issues in a fast-paced environment

What You Will Do In This Role


Help verify, clean, and ensure data is accurate and consistent across systems used for research and analysis by the various trading teams globally
Analyse datasets in order to draw conclusions and provide insight to address stakeholder or project-related questions
Collect metrics and analyse datasets across different dimensions of data quality including; completeness, validity, accuracy, timeliness, and consistency
Perform preliminary root cause analysis of data quality issues
Monitor and work through production data issues whilst engaging key stakeholders across multiple teams and facilitating global support
Assist the wider team by identifying opportunities for improving existing data pipelines


What You Will Need In This Role


Knowledge of a variety of financial instruments, in particular exposure to derivatives instruments
Experience working with SQL
Experience with cloud storage solutions
Prior experience documenting complex processes. Ideally some exposure to Confluence
Python programming skills: PySpark, Pandas, Jupyter Notebooks
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment; strong communication skills are desirable


Additional skills or experience which enhance consideration for this role


Prior experience developing data quality checks using Python
Familiarity with compressed/optimized file formats for data storage such as Parquet and HDF5
Prior experience working with Bloomberg Terminal
Familiarity with Linux and basic Bash scripting skills
Prior experience working with version control software
Experience with workflow management tools (Airflow / Argo)


For more information about DRW's processing activities and our use of job applicants' data, please view our Privacy Notice at https://drw.com/privacy-notice.

California residents, please review the California Privacy Notice for information about certain legal rights at https://drw.com/california-privacy-notice.

Title: A&R Data Analyst
Description:
Come As You Are.

As the great Kurt Cobain* once said, ‚ÄúCome as you are.‚Äù BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities and we celebrate diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity runs deep in our core value of fairness and we are determined to create a truly inclusive work environment, where everyone can flourish. If you‚Äôre good at what you do, come as you are.




All applicants to BMG will receive equal treatment regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation.*BMG is the proud representative of Kurt Cobain‚Äôs publishing catalogue, including the 1992 single ‚ÄòCome As You Are‚Äô




A&R Data Analyst (Manager)




Join BMG‚Äôs team as an A&R Data Analyst and play a pivotal role in working across social media platforms and technology, to secure artists to sign to new recordings.




Key Responsibilities.




Work across all social media platforms and using all technology to isolate and bring into the label artists to sign to New Recordings.
Work closely with investment and legal teams to pull together deals and liaise with artist managers to sign artists.
Work with SVP - New Recordings, to support artists and their recording needs.
Spend time cultivating relationships with publishers, lawyers and managers to stay aware of what other labels are signing and keeping SVP New Recordings aware of those projects.
Oversee all projects once signed to the label to make sure the artists campaigns are being managed internally.
Attend all relevant internal meetings that are relevant to the New Recordings team including A&R meetings/ Data meetings / Label meetings etc where needed.
Manage all label copy requirements for A&R Managers roster.
Manage all travel requirements for A&R Manager.




Your Profile.




Demonstrated experience in an A&R role
Experience isolating data ‚Äì working across social media platforms and using tools to understand culture and music
A positive and pro-active candidate with a strong network in the music industry




Now, what's in it for you?




25 days pro-rated annual leave, plus 3 days between Christmas & New Year and an extra
A day for your birthday!
Flexible working opportunities.
Subsidised gym membership.
Private Health Insurance.
Competitive pension scheme.
All eligible parents, regardless of gender or sexual orientation, can receive up to 6 months of fully paid parental leave.
Annual gig allowance.
Artist showcases.
Cycle to work scheme.
Season Ticket Loan
Workplace Nursery Scheme
Access to our Employee Assistance Programme.
Give As You Earn Scheme .
A fun and sociable office environment.




Pay Range:




¬£40,000 - ¬£45,000 per annum

The above salary is dependent upon factors such as work experience, qualifications and business needs. In addition to the range above, this role is eligible for a discretionary annual bonus and applicable benefits as listed above.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us:

Solirius Consulting delivers technical consultancy and application delivery to our clients in order to solve real world problems and allow our clients to respond to an ever-changing technical landscape. We partner closely with our clients, embedding our consultants into their businesses in order to provide a bespoke service, allowing us to truly understand our clients' needs.

It is this close collaboration with our clients that has enabled us to grow rapidly in recent years and will drive our ambitious future growth plans. We currently have over 250 consultants working with a variety of key clients from both the public and private sectors such as the Ministry of Justice, Department for Education, FCDOS, UEFA, International Olympic Committee and Mercedes Benz; with plans to increase our client base further in the near future.

We operate as a flat organisation and believe in trusting and supporting our team to operate independently. We pride ourselves on being specialists at what we do, making the most of our consultants' expertise in their fields in order to provide a best-in-class service to our clients. All our consultants have the opportunity to work on a range of different projects, providing a broad range of knowledge on which to develop their careers and progress in the direction they choose.

The Role:

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team here at Solirius. You will be working as part of a team, developing and delivering exciting projects with a fantastic team of technology experts. You will be a fundamental part of the team and will be an expert in your field/specialism.

Requirements

Key Responsibilities:


Develop data solutions for our clients/projects
Diagnostics and Analysis for complex technical projects
Working collaboratively with the client and understanding their requirements
Working with a range of technical professionals to reach a desired outcome, including designing and delivering technical solutions



Key Skills/Experience:


Extensive experience of Data Analytics and Data Science with the ability to use BI tools like Power BI, Tableau etc.
Extensive knowledge of Performance Analytics and tooling such as Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Amplitude etc.
Experience in capturing requirements and Governance & Control documentation, knowledge of GDS is an added advantage
Applied experience of metadata analysis, fields/entity, and data lineage, sql/ no sql databases
Experience with one of Azure/AWS/GCP
ETL tools like Informatica, Alteryx and Business Glossary tools like Collibra, Azure Purview or Apache Atlas
TDD/BDD, Experience working in an Agile development environment
Identity management and synchronisation will be an add on for the resources
Experience with Data Dictionaries, Business glossaries would be an advantage



Benefits

Package and Benefits:


Competitive salary, dependent on experience
Flexible working / Work from home
Private Healthcare
Generous annual discretionary bonus
25 days annual leave + bank holidays
10 days allocated development training per year
Contributory pension
Gym membership
Annual away days and social events



Equality & Diversity:

Solirius Consulting is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating a work environment that supports, celebrates, encourages, and respects all individuals and in which all processes are based on merit, competence and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexuality, age, disability, ethnicity, marital status or any other protected characteristics.

Should you require further assistance or require any reasonable adjustments be put in place to better support your application process, please do not hesitate to raise this with us.

Title: Data Analyst (Property)
Description:
Data Analyst (Real Estate)




Team: Operations

Role: Permanent, Full-time

Location: London (North)

Salary: Competitive + Performance Bonus + Benefits

WFH: 4 days office-based (1 day work from home)







Key Responsibilities:




Assist the department manager to ensure key projects are delivered within a planned time frame.
Providing accurate reports to various internal departments and external professional advisers as required.
Reviewing and extracting information from various sources including leases and the HM Land Registry website.
Reconciling, identifying and correcting data discrepancies on our in-house database.
Identify areas of inefficiency and collaborate with team members to design and implement new processes. Ensure these improvements align with company standards and monitor their effectiveness.
Analyse current workflows to identify opportunities for automation, using appropriate software tools to reduce manual tasks. Test and optimize automated processes to maintain accuracy and reliability.
Stay updated on technological advancements, assess their potential impact, and support the integration of new solutions. Coordinate with IT and other departments to ensure seamless implementation and enhanced system capabilities
Apply programming skills to develop and maintain automation scripts using PowerShell or similar languages. Provide documentation and training on these scripts to ensure efficient and secure operations.
Document all processes and maintain detailed records of system configurations and changes.
Coordinate systems development including planning, designing, executing, documenting and monitoring every aspect of a project.
Manage and develop website content and appearance.
Responsible for the support and maintenance of the database, including data integrity, security and optimisation.




Person Specification:




Degree or similar qualification.
Demonstratable experience with database management and process automation Intermediate or above knowledge of a programming language.
At least 1 year of work experience in a similar role.
Able to show accuracy and speed when entering data into a database, and copying from written and oral sources.
Familiarity with the latest technology trends and products.
Able to communicate effectively, help provide accurate information, and maintain a professional attitude at all times.







Our ambition is simple ‚Äì to do our best for our people, clients and communities.

We are determined to make a positive difference at work and beyond - this starts with hiring the best talent without consideration of race, religion, colour, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status or disability.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - BI - ¬£75K
Description:
Business Intelligence Analyst - BI - ¬£75K




Our client is a leading (and growing!) Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) tech firm.




Their platform enables companies to build, manage and publish powerful marketing and product campaigns.




Offering hybrid, flexible, working in their central London office, they‚Äôre looking to hire their first Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst.




You‚Äôll have the opportunity to launch new BI tools, design and develop dashboards and support data-driven decision making across the business with key stakeholders.




This is a key, growth, hire at a successful tech start-up ‚Äì You‚Äôll need to be proactive and a self-starter, love working with complex data and understanding market trends to create real business insights.

Excellent Business Intelligence (BI) and Data Analysis skills
Proficient with Power BI and / or Tableau, QlikView etc
Strong SQL skills
Experience implementing and improving BI tools
Excellent communication skills
Proven skills developing and maintaining dashboards and reports
Ability to work closely with business stakeholders and present data insights

Title: Ecommerce Data Analyst
Description:
About Us:




We‚Äôre on a mission to revolutionise women‚Äôs fashion by making it more sustainable and affordable. Our message is clear: we believe thoughtfully made clothes can exist at an accessible price point with sustainable materials. At Nobody‚Äôs Child, we‚Äôre driven by creating responsible and affordable fashion for kind and spirited women. We are an independent, London-based brand, powered by a passionate team of change makers and skilled people who make our clothes. The good news? You could be apart of the journey!




About You:




Nobody‚Äôs Child is looking for a passionate and experienced Data Analyst to join our expanding Ecommerce team to support with the unstoppable growth at Nobody's Child. As a brand new role, you'll report into our Digital Director, and lead on analysing our digital brand footprint - ultimately optimising our sales, improving our customer experience, and managing our stock and inventory even more effectively.




Day to day, you'll find yourself:




Exploring and developing tools, reporting and processes than can improve the insight and analytical capabilities of the Ecommerce team and wider business ‚Äì with a key focus on advancing the democratisation of data
Preparing the business for data automation. Auditing current processes and exploring new processes to improve efficiencies and effectiveness
Continuously thinking about the commerciality of insights and how we can quantify the impact of decisions we influence ‚Äì to build a solid understanding of where we can deliver most value and how we should prioritise work in the future
Ensuring internal stakeholders have the insights they need to ensure data & insights are used within decision making
Collaborating with the Ecommerce and cross-functional teams including Merchandising, Finance, to develop company-wide reporting
Creating tailored reports, dashboards, and performance metrics for internal stakeholders
Proactively identifying further business needs by fostering relationships throughout the business




To hit the ground running, you'll come with:




3+ years‚Äô experience in a similar role, specialising in analytics, customer behaviour analysis (web performance, returns, CRM) within Ecommerce teams
Experience with Shopify, and other web platforms such as Magento
Experience of visualisation software (Power BI / Datastudio / Looker)
Experience of ETL (extract, transform, and load) processes and database automation
Demonstrable proficiency in Google Analytics (GA4 & UA) including hands-on experience with event tracking and advanced segmentation
Strong analytical skills and data driven mindset
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, and across Microsoft Suite (or cloud-based equivalents)
Experience working with large datasets, writing efficient code & generating analysis to tight deadlines with stakeholders
Excellent collaborator, strong project management skills and ability to drive outcomes in a rapidly changing environment independently alongside collaborating across multiple teams




If this sounds like your next opportunity, please apply and we will be in touch!




At Nobody‚Äôs Child, we are committed to creating an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace. We aim to ensure that we are always recruiting, retaining and promoting a diverse mix of talent and encourage all to apply to join our journey!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
As one of the world's largest networks of audit, tax and consulting firms, RSM delivers big ideas and premium service to help middle-market businesses thrive. We are a fast-growing firm with big ambitions -- we have a clear goal to become the premium adviser to the middle market, globally. This vision touches everything we do, motivating and inspiring us to become better every day. If you are looking for a firm where you can build a future and make an impact, then RSM is the place for you.

Make an Impact at RSM UK

Consulting brings together multiple teams across Transactions, Risk & Consulting, ABA, and Outsourcing to provide client-centric solutions for RSM‚Äôs current and future clients within the middle market.‚ÄØ‚ÄØOur Consulting team has a major role to play in driving forward the growth of the firm with over 1,700 people delivering almost ¬£200m revenue.

At the heart of Consulting are the six solutions we offer our clients: business transformation, deal services, finance function support, risk and governance, forensic and investigation services, and restructuring. Our solutions create an enhanced tailored approach to support our clients in achieving their strategic goals and empower our people to make an impact and develop their own unique career path.

The Dividend Watch team offers an innovative claims management service for our clients which has seen the team recover over ¬£33m from insolvent situations for our clients.

The team also leads innovation within Creditor Solutions and have automated several of the previously manual processes, and continually looks for automation opportunities to support more efficient ways of working.The Dividend Watch Data Technician will support the client service delivery team by identifying, developing, and implementing automated solutions to optimise and streamline manual tasks. This role will involve the use of tools such as Python, Alteryx, and Robotic Process Automation (RPA) software (e.g., Automation Anywhere) to enhance operational efficiency. The individual will play a crucial part in ensuring the service delivery team can focus on high-value client interactions, while volume-based processes are efficiently managed through technology.

You will make an impact by:



Collaborating with the Dividend Watch service delivery team to understand and map out current processes.
Identifying opportunities to streamline and automate manual tasks using Python, Alteryx, and RPA tools.
Designing, building, and deploying automated workflows to manage routine tasks such as claims updates, client reporting, and data analysis.
Maintaining and improving existing automated systems to ensure they meet evolving business needs.
Ensuring that automation solutions align with client needs and service delivery standards.
Monitoring automated processes and resolving any issues that arise in a timely manner.
Supporting the team by managing and maintaining the integrity of data, ensuring it is up to date and accurate.
Providing technical guidance and best practices on automation and data management to the service delivery team.
Continuously exploring new technologies and automation tools to enhance the efficiency of the Dividend Watch function.
Assisting in client reporting by automating the production of data-driven insights and summaries.



What we are looking for:

We value diverse experiences and perspectives. Here‚Äôs what we‚Äôre looking for in our ideal candidate:



Strong knowledge and experience in process automation using tools like Python, Alteryx, and RPA platforms (e.g., Automation Anywhere).
A high degree of adaptability and the ability to quickly learn and assess current manual processes.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to design logical, coherent automation solutions.
Detail-oriented with the ability to manage and optimise high volumes of data accurately and efficiently.
Excellent communication skills to work effectively with the service delivery team and explain technical concepts in non-technical terms.
Good time management and organisational skills to manage multiple projects concurrently.
Willingness to explore new tools and methods for continuous improvement of automated processes.



What we can offer you:

We recognise that our people are our most important assets. That‚Äôs why we offer a flexible reward and benefits package that will help you have fulfilling experience, both in and out of work.



Study Support
Hybrid and Flexible working
25 Days Holiday with the option of purchasing additional days
Lifestyle, Health, and Wellbeing including financial wellbeing benefits such as financial tools, electric car scheme and access to a virtual GP.
Access to a suite of 300+ courses on demand developed by our inhouse Talent Development team.



Diversity and Inclusion at RSM

At RSM, we want to create a strong sense of belonging so that people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures feel they can bring their true self to work. Our clients come from all walks of life. We aim to achieve that same diversity of background, experience and perspective in our own teams, so that we can genuinely understand our client's needs. Diverse teams bring a broader range of ideas and insights to work. That's why we're working together to ensure our firm's principles and processes support a firm culture that embraces difference and strengthens inclusion.

Make an Impact at RSM UK

Consulting brings together multiple teams across Transactions, Risk & Consulting, ABA, and Outsourcing to provide client-centric solutions for RSM‚Äôs current and future clients within the middle market.‚ÄØ‚ÄØOur Consulting team has a major role to play in driving forward the growth of the firm with over 1,700 people delivering almost ¬£200m revenue.

At the heart of Consulting are the six solutions we offer our clients: business transformation, deal services, finance function support, risk and governance, forensic and investigation services, and restructuring. Our solutions create an enhanced tailored approach to support our clients in achieving their strategic goals and empower our people to make an impact and develop their own unique career path.

The Dividend Watch team offers an innovative claims management service for our clients which has seen the team recover over ¬£33m from insolvent situations for our clients.

The team also leads innovation within Creditor Solutions and have automated several of the previously manual processes, and continually looks for automation opportunities to support more efficient ways of working.The Dividend Watch Data Technician will support the client service delivery team by identifying, developing, and implementing automated solutions to optimise and streamline manual tasks. This role will involve the use of tools such as Python, Alteryx, and Robotic Process Automation (RPA) software (e.g., Automation Anywhere) to enhance operational efficiency. The individual will play a crucial part in ensuring the service delivery team can focus on high-value client interactions, while volume-based processes are efficiently managed through technology.

You will make an impact by:


  • Collaborating with the Dividend Watch service delivery team to understand and map out current processes.
  • Identifying opportunities to streamline and automate manual tasks using Python, Alteryx, and RPA tools.
  • Designing, building, and deploying automated workflows to manage routine tasks such as claims updates, client reporting, and data analysis.
  • Maintaining and improving existing automated systems to ensure they meet evolving business needs.
  • Ensuring that automation solutions align with client needs and service delivery standards.
  • Monitoring automated processes and resolving any issues that arise in a timely manner.
  • Supporting the team by managing and maintaining the integrity of data, ensuring it is up to date and accurate.
  • Providing technical guidance and best practices on automation and data management to the service delivery team.
  • Continuously exploring new technologies and automation tools to enhance the efficiency of the Dividend Watch function.
  • Assisting in client reporting by automating the production of data-driven insights and summaries.


What we are looking for:

We value diverse experiences and perspectives. Here‚Äôs what we‚Äôre looking for in our ideal candidate:


  • Strong knowledge and experience in process automation using tools like Python, Alteryx, and RPA platforms (e.g., Automation Anywhere).
  • A high degree of adaptability and the ability to quickly learn and assess current manual processes.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to design logical, coherent automation solutions.
  • Detail-oriented with the ability to manage and optimise high volumes of data accurately and efficiently.
  • Excellent communication skills to work effectively with the service delivery team and explain technical concepts in non-technical terms.
  • Good time management and organisational skills to manage multiple projects concurrently.
  • Willingness to explore new tools and methods for continuous improvement of automated processes.


What we can offer you:

We recognise that our people are our most important assets. That‚Äôs why we offer a flexible reward and benefits package that will help you have fulfilling experience, both in and out of work.


  • Study Support
  • Hybrid and Flexible working
  • 25 Days Holiday with the option of purchasing additional days
  • Lifestyle, Health, and Wellbeing including financial wellbeing benefits such as financial tools, electric car scheme and access to a virtual GP.
  • Access to a suite of 300+ courses on demand developed by our inhouse Talent Development team.


Diversity and Inclusion at RSM

At RSM, we want to create a strong sense of belonging so that people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures feel they can bring their true self to work. Our clients come from all walks of life. We aim to achieve that same diversity of background, experience and perspective in our own teams, so that we can genuinely understand our client's needs. Diverse teams bring a broader range of ideas and insights to work. That's why we're working together to ensure our firm's principles and processes support a firm culture that embraces difference and strengthens inclusion.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Campaign Executive
Location: Fully Remote
Salary: ¬£25,000 + team based commission




Company Overview

Our client is a tech start-up specialising in data, audience and demand acquisition for clients around the globe. No matter who their customers want to reach‚Äîor where‚Äîthey excel at crafting tailored initiatives that reflect the specific needs of target audiences.




About You

We‚Äôre seeking an individual who‚Äôs excited to join a growing, close-knit team and begin (or advance) their career in a vibrant media environment. Prior experience in a B2B operational capacity is ideal, but not mandatory, someone with the drive and willingness to develop alongside the business is more important.




Your Role

Collaborate with the Campaign Management team to ensure that all leads and related data are verified, accurate, and current.
Perform initial quality checks on data by validating it against multiple sources (for instance, verifying job titles, phone numbers, and other essential details).
Set up and launch new campaigns, which involves creating automated checks in our data validation systems and handling any necessary API integrations (full training provided).
Tackle ad hoc tasks as assigned by team leaders or the broader campaign management group.
Keep campaigns running smoothly and deliver top-notch service to all clients, every time.
Provide clear updates on campaign responsiveness to accurately forecast future performance.
Take on operational and analytical duties, like segmenting data and evaluating response rates using various technology platforms (training will be provided).
Double-check data reliability and flag any shortcomings when needed.




Essential Qualifications

A degree in a data-focused area (e.g., Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Sciences, or Engineering)
A passion for data-centric work
Strong communication skills
Energy, enthusiasm, and willingness to align with team objectives




What We Look For

Enthusiasm for working with data
Naturally analytical mindset
Comfort with data-entry tasks
Quick adoption of new tools and software
Strong proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint
Problem-solving mentality
Professional, dependable, and punctual
Ability to work remotely and adapt to flexible schedules
Confidence in meeting goals and quotas
Clear communication and readiness to seek help when needed
Highly driven and motivated
Open-minded and eager to learn from seasoned colleagues
Thrives in a dynamic, positive, and hard-working environment




Culture

This company are developing a lively and supportive environment. Leadership operates within a flat structure, ensuring you can learn directly from the most experienced members of the team. You‚Äôll find this a great place to refine your skills, make real progress, and share a few laughs along the way.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Position Summary

Why join our team?

Since its founding in Suwon, Korea in 1969, Samsung Electronics has grown into a global information technology leader, managing more than 200 subsidiaries around the world. Samsung EO is formed by 17 divisions (subsidiaries) across Europe that represent circa $32 billion in sales! It has recently become the leading Consumer Electronics brand in the region in terms of recognition and most preferred by consumers.

The ESBO division is the European Services Business Office, responsible for all Samsung services on TV and mobile devices such as Samsung TV Plus, Universal Guide, Samsung Gaming Hub, Art Store, and Multiple Voice Assistance. The Product Management team oversees the operations, content curation, programming, analysis and marketing of Samsung smart TV and mobile services across 16 European countries.

Role And Responsibilities

Your Key Responsibilities:

We‚Äôre looking for a driven, collaborative and forward thinking person. In this role, you will work alongside with our Business Intelligence team and Data Engineers to deliver data driven solutions, including dashboards, reports and Key Performance Indictors)

You will report directly to the Senior Manager - Business Intelligence based in London and work closely with finance teams based in the 80 Strand office.

If you are interested in joining a rapidly growing team working to build a unique, world-class advertising organisation with a steadfast focus on delivering real results to customers, you've come to the right place!

What will be your key deliverables?


Capture requirements, conceptualise and develop BI solutions such as dashboards, reports and KPI‚Äôs that will drive business performance and support management decision-making.
Analyse data to solve complex problems and evaluate scenarios to make predictions on future outcomes and support decision making.
Analyse financial performance against KPI‚Äôs and industry benchmarks.
Support monthly, quarterly and annual financial close processes through data-driven insights.
Collaborate with the finance team to develop accurate financial forecasts and models.
Track and analyse business metrics related to TV Ad campaigns and sales performance.
Identify trends, risks, and opportunities to improve operational and financial efficiency.
Contribute to the simplification, improvement and scaling of existing processes and tools. Consider and develop alternative and innovative data solutions, transforming data into insights that drive value
Support the wider team in engaging with our BI platform(s); providing education, guidance and product optimisation to drive toward it becoming a truly self-serve tool for the organisation.
Strong and effective communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of clients and staff.
Perform deep-dives to derive actionable insights
Work with large data sets to enable better decision making



What We Need For This Role

To be successful, you will possess the following skills and attributes:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent in STEM, Economics, Data Analytics, Finance or related field.
2+ years of experience in a Business Intelligence or similar role, preferably within the media, advertising, or TV industry.
Attention to detail, ability to multitask and strong organisational skills required.
Must be task driven & have the ability to produce and hit key deliverable deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Strong Excel skills are required, including a good understanding of formulas, macros, pivot tables.
Proven experience in data modelling and reporting.
Intermediate level experience working with Python
Solid experience in SQL and Data visualisation (DOMO, Tableau, Power BI or similar)
Understanding of database design and management.
Experience working with finance data or in a finance team ‚Äì a plus
Experience working with Salesforce - a plus
Experience working with Operative.One - a plus
Experience working with SAP - a plus
Experience working with statistical analysis/tools - a plus
Familiarity with media, TV measurement - a plus
Strong written and verbal communication skills



Skills And Qualifications

Benefits of working at Samsung as a Partner Colleague include:


Hybrid working ‚Äì 3 days in the office and 2 days at home per week
Bonus scheme linked to individual, team and company performance
Car allowance (delete if not appropriate)
Pension contribution
Three volunteering days each year
Holiday - 25 days plus bank holidays and an additional day off for your birthday
Access to discounts on a wide range of Samsung products
Access to a discount shopping portal
Partner Colleagues are not eligible for Samsung Enhanced Paid Sick Leave but may be eligible for statutory payments from their payroll agency
Up to 20 (pro-rata) Partner Absence days per calendar year to be used in times of need



A note on equal opportunities

We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our Company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.


Please visit Samsung membership to see Privacy Policy, which defaults according to your location, at: https://account.samsung.com/membership/policy/privacy. You can change Country/Language at the bottom of the page. If you are European Economic Resident, please click here: https://europe-samsung.com/ghrp/PrivacyNoticeforEU.html

Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst
Description:
Who is Taco Bell?




Taco Bell is a leading Mexican-inspired quick service restaurant brand that is a part of Yum! Brands, Inc. which includes Pizza Hut and KFC. Founded on innovation and passion with Glen Bell bringing tacos to the masses in a world of hot dog and hamburger stands in 1962, today we have nearly 7,000 restaurants in the United States and over 400 restaurants in 27 countries outside of the United States. The future holds 2,000 more restaurants across the globe within the next decade. It's easy to see we‚Äôre in the business of making tacos, but at heart, we‚Äôre a business that‚Äôs fueled by the Live M√°s energy and passion of people serving people.







What is ‚ÄúLive M√°s‚Äù?




Equally important to the job role and responsibilities is making sure the Supply Chain Data Analyst can represent the amazing Live M√°s! culture that is Taco Bell. At Taco Bell, we embrace breakthrough thinking and innovative ideas that continue to differentiate us from our competitors. We have a maniacal focus on our customers, never follow, and always celebrate the accomplishments of our people. If you want to have fun serving great food to our customers, we would love to meet with you.




About the Job:




The Supply Chain Data Analyst will be part of UK & Europe Supply Chain Team, a dynamic team that values collaboration, resourcefulness, and enthusiasm. You will closely work with the pan-EU supply chain team, internal and external partners helping to leverage data and insights to report, continuously optimise performance and deliver our supply chain ambitions. You will support the Taco Bell Europe supply chain team by providing actionable insights and analytics to drive decision-making, enhance operational efficiency, and improve supplier performance. The role is instrumental in ensuring accurate forecasting, cost management, and supply chain optimisation across multiple European markets.




This position is based out of UK office and is ideal for individuals with high accountability, strong analytical skills, great attention to detail, intellectual curiosity, and a drive for results. In this role you will:




Automate the short, medium, and long terms demand baseline forecast at SKU item level in Power BI
Collect, clean, and analyse data from multiple sources including supplier reports, sales forecasts and market trends
Develop and maintain dashboards to track KPIs such as cost of sales, supplier performance, forecast vs actuals, stock holding & weeks cover
Develop and provide weekly reporting to the Supply Chain leadership team
Creation of full end to end commercial reporting ‚Äì full visibility of stock in the network
Review historical trends, research demand drivers, prepare forecast data, develop statistical models, and evaluate forecast results
Perform root cause analysis on key forecast deviations. Supports Business, Marketing, Logistics, and production strategies and identify opportunities to meet market needs
In collaboration with Logistics and Buying Team, ensure the right stock is in the right place at the right time to deliver customer requirements at DC level
Work with Marketing and Finance teams to combine, refine and publish total business demand plan (in applicable levels / aggregated views e.g., by product, by category etc.)
Create insights from business forecast analysis to drive continuous improvement (specifically from a proactiveness point of view) in Supply Chain
Incorporate market intelligence into demand plans
Lead promotional activity forecast planning at SKU item level
Support cost modelling for new market entries
Work with Procurement team to develop, enhance and simplify processes







Is This You?




Minimum of 2-4 years experience in supply chain analytics, procurement, or logistics management
Data and analysis-driven with advanced Excel skills
Advanced proficiency with data visualisation tools (e.g. Power BI)
Self-starter capable of solving complex problems with limited data
Bachelor‚Äôs degree preferred
Experience working at International restaurant business, food retailer, food supplier, or in food manufacturing is a plus
Demonstrated ability to plan and coordinate workflow and outputs efficiently across multiple functional groups
Strong communications (presentation, verbal, writing) and relationship development skills
Strong process creation and optimization
Entrepreneurial
Commercial thinker
High level of intellectual curiosity
Ability to influence diverse customers in cross-functional setting







Why Taco Bell?




We truly believe that where you work matters, and we know a thing or two about what makes employees happy. Join us on our mission of feeding people‚Äôs lives with M√°s!




We are about more than just building restaurants‚Äîwe connect with our fans through their passions including sports, gaming, and music
We know that employees want a company they can live and grow with; they crave a unique culture that fosters creativity and encourages pursuit of passion, and they look for opportunities to take risks, develop skills and learn in ways that fit their lifestyle
We foster a culture of authenticity and believe all people can make a difference




Work-Hard, Play-Hard:




Company and performance related bonus
Generous pension with up to 11% company contribution
Private healthcare with the option to increase to include family cover and extra dental cover
Annual holiday allowance starts at 25 days with the option to buy or sell up to 3 extra days per year
5 extra company recharge days a year
After 5 years‚Äô service, annual holiday allowance increases to 30 days
We offer competitive parental leave and flexible return to work options
Pick n Mix Benefits to convert them into your very own benefits plans that‚Äôs unique to you - options include gym membership, health screening and travel insurance
Flexible working
Opportunity to taste a lot of Taco Bell!
Recognition based culture and unique, fun events year round
Hybrid work schedule
Discounts, free food, swag and‚Ä¶ honestly, too many good benefits to name




At Taco Bell, we Live M√°s and invite you to do the same. Take a seat at our table. Bring your voice. Bring you, just as you are, a Cultural Rebel. We want you to be your best self!




Taco Bell is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to equity, inclusion, and belonging for all dimensions of diversity.

Title: Global Customer Data Analyst
Description:
About AvePoint

Securing the Future. AvePoint is a global leader in data management and data governance, and over 21,000 customers worldwide rely on our solutions to modernize the digital workplace across Microsoft, Google, Salesforce and other collaboration environments. AvePoint‚Äôs global channel partner program includes over 3,500 managed service providers, value added resellers and systems integrators, with our solutions available in more than 100 cloud marketplaces. To learn more, visit www.avepoint.com.

At AvePoint, we are committed to investing in our people. Agility, passion and teamwork set us up to do our best work and foster a culture where you are empowered to craft your career, make an impact, and own (y)our future. Unleash the power of you!

About The Role

AvePoint is seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Customer Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics Team. In this role, you will be responsible for gathering, integrating, modelling, and analysing customer data from various sources, including CRM, marketing campaign systems, and customer success system. Your insights will help drive strategic decision-making across marketing, sales, and customer success functions, contributing to improved customer engagement and overall business growth.

Key Responsibilities


Data Collection and Integration: Gather customer data from various internal systems, including CRM, marketing automation, sales platforms, and customer success tools, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Data Modelling: Develop and maintain data models that represent customer journeys, engagement, and interactions across the customer lifecycle.
Data Analysis and Reporting: Analyse customer data to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that drive strategic decisions in marketing, sales, and customer success.
Campaign Analysis: Evaluate the effectiveness of marketing and sales campaigns, providing recommendations to optimize future strategies.
Customer Segmentation: Perform customer segmentation and cohort analysis to identify key customer groups and tailor marketing and engagement strategies accordingly.
KPI Development and Tracking: Develop, track, and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) related to customer acquisition, retention, and satisfaction.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional, global teams, including marketing, sales, customer success, and finance, to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Data Quality and Governance: Ensure data integrity and compliance with data governance standards, implementing processes to clean and validate customer data.
Visualization and Presentation: Create dashboards, visualizations, and presentations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders at all levels of the organization


The Ideal Candidate Has


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field. Master‚Äôs degree preferred.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a SaaS or technology environment, with a focus on customer data analytics. Experience in SaaS B2B performance metrics such as Annual Recurring Revenue, Net Recurring Revenue, and Gross Recurring Revenue analysis is a plus.
Proficiency in SQL, Python/R, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) a must. Experience with customer systems such as CRM systems (e.g., Dynamics CRM), Gainsight CS, Everstage Commission, Segment Marketing, DealHub, OutReach, and Zoominfo experience are also a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable insights.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly and persuasively.
High level of accuracy and attention to detail in data handling and analysis.
Understanding of sales, marketing, and customer success processes and how data can inform strategy and decision-making.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment


AvePoint is proud to employ talent from many different backgrounds, experiences, and identities. We believe that diversity and inclusion drives our success and is at the core of how we hire, communicate, and collaborate to deliver value and excellence. We are committed to fostering an environment where people can bring their whole selves to work and feel a sense of belonging, and we continue to work toward creating a workforce that represents the diversity of our customers and communities.

Any personal data you share with us during the application process will be processed strictly in compliance with applicable data protection laws and our Privacy Notice.

About AvePoint

Securing the Future. AvePoint‚Äôs global channel partner program includes over 3,500 managed service providers, value added resellers and systems integrators, with our solutions available in more than 100 cloud marketplaces. To learn more, visit www.avepoint.com.

At AvePoint, we are committed to investing in our people. Agility, passion and teamwork set us up to do our best work and foster a culture where you are empowered to craft your career, make an impact, and own (y)our future. Unleash the power of you!

About The Role

AvePoint is seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Customer Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics Team. In this role, you will be responsible for gathering, integrating, modelling, and analysing customer data from various sources, including CRM, marketing campaign systems, and customer success system. Your insights will help drive strategic decision-making across marketing, sales, and customer success functions, contributing to improved customer engagement and overall business growth.

Key Responsibilities

  • Data Collection and Integration: Gather customer data from various internal systems, including CRM, marketing automation, sales platforms, and customer success tools, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.

  • Visualization and Presentation: Create dashboards, visualizations, and presentations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders at all levels of the organization

  • Proficiency in SQL, Python/R, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) a must. Experience with customer systems such as CRM systems (e.g., Dynamics CRM), Gainsight CS, Everstage Commission, Segment Marketing, DealHub, OutReach, and Zoominfo experience are also a plus.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable insights.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly and persuasively.
  • High level of accuracy and attention to detail in data handling and analysis.
  • Understanding of sales, marketing, and customer success processes and how data can inform strategy and decision-making.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment

We believe that diversity and inclusion drives our success and is at the core of how we hire, communicate, and collaborate to deliver value and excellence. Title: Data Analyst, New Grad
Description:
About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies‚Äîfrom the world‚Äôs largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups‚Äîuse Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone‚Äôs reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

Data Science at Stripe is a vibrant community where data analysts, data scientists and engineers learn and grow together. You will work with some of Stripe‚Äôs most fundamental and exciting data, and use that data to help drive company-wide initiatives. We have a variety of Data Analytics roles and teams across Stripe and will seek to align you to the most relevant team based on your background.

What you'll do

In this role, you will partner deeply with teams across Stripe to ensure that our users, our products, and our business have the models, data products, and insights needed to make decisions and grow responsibly. You will work closely with partners to extract insights from Stripe's rich and complex data. You will also work with leaders to translate business needs into data problems. You will build metrics, scalable data pipelines, dashboards, and reports to inform and run the business. You will deliver actionable business recommendations through analyses and data storytelling.

Who you are

We‚Äôre looking for fresh graduates who meet the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements


Enrolled in a quantitative Master‚Äôs program (e.g. Business Intelligence Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Science, Engineering, Economics, or Computer Science) with the expectation of graduating in winter 2024 or spring/summer 2025
Experience with a scientific computing language (such as Python, R, etc) and SQL. We believe new programming languages can be learned if the fundamentals and general knowledge are present!
Strong statistical knowledge
Expertise in visualization and using data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
Proven ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with great attention to detail
Ability to clearly communicate results and drive impact
Comfortable collaborating across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with technical rigor and data-driven insights



Preferred Qualifications


Experience writing and debugging data pipelines
Demonstrated ability to evaluate and receive feedback from mentors, peers, and stakeholders via experience from previous internships or other multi-person projects
Ability to learn new systems and form an understanding of those systems, through independent research and working with a mentor and subject matter experts
This role is not eligible for hire in the Greater Seattle Area, San Francisco Bay Area, or New York City. We are hiring these positions in Chicago, IL or Toronto, Ontario, Canada.



Hybrid work at Stripe

Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.

Pay and benefits

The annual US base salary range for this role is $144,300 - $216,500. For sales roles, the range provided is the role‚Äôs On Target Earnings ("OTE") range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate‚Äôs experience, qualifications, and location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the US may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Additional benefits for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; 401(k) plan; medical, dental, and vision benefits; and wellness stipends.

Title: Data Analyst, Loyalty & Partnerships
Description:
At Lyft, our purpose is to serve and connect. To do this, we start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization.

Data and analytics are at the heart of Lyft‚Äôs products and decision-making. The Rider organization is focused on building a seamless, best-in-class rideshare experience for riders, by meeting their painpoints and building products best suited to solve them. As a Data Analyst on the Rider Segments and Partnerships team, you‚Äôll partner directly with cross-functional stakeholders to identify opportunities and design solutions for improving Rider experience. You will partner closely with product, science, engineering, design, research, marketing and business development to deliver 0-to-1 products end-to-end. You‚Äôll leverage your analytical expertise to deliver actionable insights and recommendations to drive quality business decisions with customer-facing impact.

The ideal candidate is obsessed with improving customer experience with data insights, a critical thinker and exceptional problem solver who can identify business opportunities and drive impact and cross-functional alignment, shaping product and business strategy through data-centric presentations.

Responsibilities:


Manage and owns the end-to-end analysis on rider experience, including creating frameworks, defining key metrics, develop dashboards and monitoring business health to drive decision-making and prioritization based on Lyft's business, strategy, and mission
Work closely with cross-functional partners (e.g. Science, Engineering, Product, Marketing) to deliver actionable data-driven insights and identify opportunities for continuously improving the rider experience
Monitor and diagnose our suite of products in rider segments and partnerships
Create and monitor product performance dashboards and communicates findings to cross-functional team
Act as a subject-matter expert and thought partner in focused product area
Breaks down complex problems from end-to-end and leads execution towards business impact with clear goals.
Design A/B testing and execute analyses to evaluate the impact of new product feature improvements


Experience:


Degree in a quantitative field (e.g. statistics, applied math, economics, engineering)
4+ years of relevant work experience
Experience in leading data-driven projects from definition to execution
Proficiency in SQL and Python
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to transition between data and business problems
Exceptional communication (listening, written, and oral) skills with the ability to present findings & recommendations targeted to the audience in question
Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and trust across functions and work collaboratively
Experience in online experimentation and statistical analysis
Passion for driving business impact with data


Preferred Experience:


Entre/intrapreneurial experience launching new products
Advanced degrees in quantitative fields
Experience with two-sided market problems
Experience in driving product growth with data insights, including understanding user behaviors, long-term user value, and product lifecycle


Benefits:


Extended health and dental coverage options, along with life insurance and disability benefits
Mental health benefits
Family building benefits
Access to a Health Care Savings Account
In addition to provincial observed holidays, team members get 15 days paid time off, with an additional day for each year of service
4 Floating Holidays each calendar year prorated based off of date of hire
10 paid sick days per year regardless of province
18 weeks of paid parental leave. Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligible


Lyft proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Lyft believes that every person has a right to equal employment opportunities without discrimination because of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, pardoned record of offences, or any other basis protected by applicable law or by Company policy. Lyft also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Accommodation for persons with disabilities will be provided upon request in accordance with applicable law during the application and hiring process. Please contact your recruiter now if you wish to make such a request.

This role will be in-office on a hybrid schedule ‚Äî Team Members will be expected to work in the office 3 days per week on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Additionally, hybrid roles have the flexibility to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per year. #Hybrid

The expected base pay range for this position in the Toronto area is 92,800 CAD - 116,000 CAD. Salary ranges are dependent on a variety of factors, including qualifications, experience and geographic location. Range is not inclusive of potential equity offering, bonus or benefits. Your recruiter can share more information about the salary range specific to your working location and other factors during the hiring process.
